loans.name: Kiran's Group

texts.en:
Kiran, age 22, is wearing a green dress in the given picture. 

Her husband is a vegetable supplier who has supplied the vegetable market in a nearby town for many years. Her husband brings vegetables from the field and supplies to the retailers. He has been feeding his children and old parents from generated income from this business. 

Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so that he can do maximum sales.

Therefore, Kiran requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy more seasonal vegetables than in the past.

Kiran thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy vegetables from the field for supplying  to the market.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is  taking a loan of USD 1,200 to improve her business. She is married and she has seven children. 

Isabel is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as fish, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Pan, and Break. 

She opened her kiosk a year ago, with her own working capital of USD 500.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Pan, and Break for her kiosk.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is requesting a new loan to purchase larger quanities of broom  supplies and related equipment to make and sell a larger quantity of broom products. Hong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make brooms.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is acting as group leader and taking the responsibility for her group members. This is Bushra's third loan; she has taken the responsibility on the behalf of all group members, and she affirmed that she will pay all installments on time because she wants to take out another loan in the future. Bushra is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Bushra is a 48-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is requested a loan for her husband’s fruit-selling business. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the community and participates in the household expenses. He likes to sell seasonal fruit, and right now he wants to buy oranges in large quantity to sell because it's their season and their price is very low.
 
Therefore, Bushra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so her husband can buy the oranges in bulk. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will soon be able to save a reasonable amount.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruit such as oranges in bulk.

loans.name: Sol's Group

texts.en:
Sol is a 28-year-old married woman residing in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, She has two children to take care of and earns a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sol has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Sol will use her portion to pay for harvesting rice fields. She hopes to grow more rice so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting rice fields.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon es un joven responsable, padre de familia, quien a diario despierta motivado por la esperanza y el amor que le tiene a sus dos hijitos quienes están en edad escolar y desea sacarlos adelante, su esposa tuvo que viajar a otro país en busca de empleo para una vida mejor, mientras Marlon desea que algún día pueda estar unida su familia, el se dedica al comercio, vende películas, música, discos en blanco, accesorios de celulares controles de tv y radio, solicita este crédito para abastecer su negocio con variedades que es lo que le hace fala, para continuar vendiendo, así custodiar los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marlon is a responsible young man, a father, who wakes up every day motivated by the hope and love he has for his two little school-age children and his desire to care for them properly. His wife had to travel to another country in search of employment for a better life, while Marlon hopes that someday his family can be united.
He makes his living with a shop, selling movies, music, blank discs, mobile phone accessories, and TV and radio remote controls. He is requesting this loan to stock his shop with a variety of items that he needs in order to continue selling, and in this way take care of his children’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy movies, music, blank discs, mobile phone accessories, and TV and radio remote controls

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is a 33-year-old, married man. He has one child. He describes himself as being social. He operates a transport business where he transports customers, using his motorcycle.

He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be expensive fuel. 

Kelvin will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a car for business, within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his living standards. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to pay school fees for his child. Previously, he was doing farming to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería es una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser hospitalaria ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y raspadillas, en el exterior del mercado de su distrito, Teofila se dedica a esta labor para apoyar con los gastos familiares tiene una familia unida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para arreglos de su baño y ducha y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Teofila is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotún. The inhabitants of Oyotún work in agriculture, business and raising livestock, and are known for their hospitality. Oyotún is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

Teofila works selling soft drinks and snow cones outside the market of her district. She does this work to help pay her family’s household expenses and to keep her family together.

She has requested a loan of 4,000 PEN to make repairs to her bathroom and shower, so that she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs to her bathroom and shower.

loans.name: María Elba

texts.es:
María de 59 años de edad, estudio hasta 5 grado, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, de los cuales uno vive con ella.

La cliente tiene 30 años de vender medicina natural, este trabajo lo aprendió de su mamá, decidió dedicarse a este trabajo ya que le deja buenos ingresos, para ella y su familia. Antes de este negocio,  vendía ropa. Ella vende ambulantemente en toda la ciudad,  la distancia que recorre diaria es de 2 horas, su hijo se involucra también y le ayuda a vender electrodomésticos

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar medicina natural y electrodomésticos para vender ambulantemente en dos ciudades. Su vida va a mejorar; ya que va tener capital de trabajo, así tendrá mejores ingresos para ella y su familia.
Sus sueños son que su negocio crezca y que los ingresos sean mejores para ella y su familia, las ganancias las usara para tener más ingresos por el comercio.
texts.en:
María is 59 years old. She studied through 5th grade and is a single mother of two children, one of which lives with her. She has sold natural medicine for 30 years, work she learned from her mother. She decided to make a living at this work as it provides her and her family with a good income. Prior to this business, she sold clothes. She makes her sales as a street vendor all over the city everyday for 2 hours. Her son is involved and he helps sell electric household appliances. 

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is for purchasing natural medicine and electric household appliances to sell as a street vendor in two cities. Her life will improve as she will have working capital, and that way she will have a better income for her and her family. 

Her dream is for her business to grow and that her income improves for her and her family. She will use the earnings to have more revenue for her business.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine and electric household appliances to sell as a street vendor between two cities

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 56-years-old and married with three children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Thelma has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Thelma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga, 55-years-old, is widowed and has two daughters. She supports family through the income she earns from selling food from her stall. She has begun this business this year. She and her children live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nga intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy chickens and rice to make meals for selling. The additional capital will enable her to attract more and new customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy chickens and rice to make meals for selling.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 28 years old and comes from Naivasha. He is married to Loice. They have one child who is four years old.

John is a banana vendor and has been in that business for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy more bananas to add to his stock. John is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan. 

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to add to his stock

loans.name: Dariljef

texts.en: Dariljef, 33, is married with two kids. He has been engaged in his farming business for eight years. He currently cultivates 1.5 hectares of rice fields.With his determination to improve the growth of his rice crops, he decided to seek additional capital of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his farming business. He hopes that lenders will grant his requested loan so that he can give his family a better way of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for his farming business.

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en: Ma. Linda is married with three children and helps her husband work in their own farm to make a living. For nine years in their farm, she has earned well for the family and has sent her children to school. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer in order to improve the farm. She hopes to gain more harvest from the farm and be able to use a portion of her profit for their house renovation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. 

Prudence still operates a beauty salon business. She would like to apply for a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners

loans.name: Miraj

texts.en:
Miraj is the age of 51, living in a rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hard-working and gentle person. He is responsible for his six children. 

Miraj is a milkman by profession and he sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk since a young age. Now, he is very expert and experienced about his profession. He is very expert in getting milk from a buffalo; he gets milk from all his buffaloes in no time. 

He has many buffaloes, this is the reason why he has to do very hard work to feed them. Every day, Miraj takes his buffaloes to the pasture for grazing and gives them baths in the stream. He has to stay the whole day with his buffaloes, due to fear of theft. He does not have much time for his family members. 

Miraj wants to appoint an assistant to look after his cattle, but he does not earn enough profit to afford his salary. Miraj is taking his second loan and he has been investing his previous loan in the same business. With the help of the last loan, he purchased a buffalo and he has been getting benefit from that buffalo. Miraj still wants to establish his dairy farm and wants to buy an additional buffalo to increase his herd, so he can increase his herd and his monthly income, and appoint an assistant, so he could spend some time with his family.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo, to increase his herd.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 52 years old and married, with seven children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elvie runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La señora esperanza, se levanta desde muy temprano hasta acostarse a altas horas de la noche cumpliendo con los encargos de costura que recibe de sus clientes, siendo esta su profesión que ejerce durante años, su esposo por su parte se dedica a la carpintería por cuenta propia. Doña Esperanza solicito un crédito anterior para la construcción de un porche y mejorar un cuarto que tiene en alquiler, pero debido al alza de los productos no pudo concluir con lo propuesto, logrando solamente comprar un inodoro y la puesta del piso del cuarto; con este nuevo crédito solicitado podrá terminar esta obra que tanto  anhela para la comodidad en su hogar, con el financiamiento comprara los materiales: laminas de zinc, madera y perlines.
texts.en: Esperanza spends the time between getting up early in the morning and going to bed late at night filling sewing orders from her clients.  This has been her profession for years.  Her husband works for himself as a carpenter.  Esperanza took out a prior loan to build a porch and improve a room she was renting, but she wasn't able to complete the job due to increased cost of supplies.  She managed only to buy a toilet and put down a floor in the room.  With the new loan she's seeking she'll be able to finish the job she so longs to do to provide comfort in her home.  She'll use the loan to buy materials including zinc sheets, wood, and iron beams.

loans.use: to buy materials: zinc sheets, wood, and iron beams.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en:
Tuyen, 42, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband's family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a security guard for a residential quarter.

Tuyen has been running a general store in front of her house for 15 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different products such as milk, sugar and noodles to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy sugar, milk and noodles to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh, 59, is married and has two sons. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He and his wife earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

He started this business twelve years ago. He sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in his community. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock his store and better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock his store.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is 44 years old and is married with three children. She and her husband have been running a business of selling electrical appliances and construction materials in front of their door for 18 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her child. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Linh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of brick, sand, stone, and water pipes so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of bricks, sand, stones, and water pipes.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, 37, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a bricklayer. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

Ngoc started this business 10 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Yoy

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Yoy is a 50-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are dependent on her and still in school. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice, growing vegetables, raising pigs and sometimes catching fish for 21 years. Her family’s daily income is about US $32 per day but she can manage to save about US $10 each day after expenses. 

Yoy has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now she is asking for an education loan to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee to study midwifery. She hopes that her daughter will have a special skill for a long-term income which will support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Bridaine

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de repuestos de carros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende llantas, motores entre otros a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca  adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de repuestos para carros como lunas entre otros. 
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Bridaine, continues to work in her business selling spare parts for cars.  She's been in the business for years and it's going well thanks to her daily management.  She sells tires, motors, and other items to her clients who request them.  She's a responsible and diligent person, which is how she gets her family ahead.

Bridaine is seeking a loan to buy spare auto parts such as window glass, etc.  She feels grateful for the loan and promises to make all of her payments.

loans.use: to buy auto parts like window glass, etc.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 56-year-old businesswoman from Thika. She has a business as a poultry farmer. She is married to Stanley, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with five children, ages 19, 16, 15, 14, and 13 years, respectively. Jane earns a monthly income of KES 11,800 which she uses to support her family. 

This marks Jane's third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, successfully repaying her previous loans. With the loan, she will be able to purchase poultry feed and purchase one-day-old chicks to rear. 

Additional income created will allow Jane to improve the standard of living for her family. In the future, Jane would like to further expand her poultry farming. She hopes to have an established business and a settled family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and one-day-old chicks.

loans.name: Domingo Jose

texts.es: El señor Domingo habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, acompañado padre de dos niños pequeños, el es conductor de una mototaxi desde hace ocho años, su mayor sueño es poder mejorar su casa de habitacion en la actualidad esta utilizando como pared tejas de Zinc. el credito lo solicita para comprar Piedras, Bloques, Cemento, Hierro. con esto sus hijos tendran mayor seguridad y sus condiciones de vida mejoraran, Agradece a Kiva y Afodenic el apoyo que le estan brindando con este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Domingo lives in Ticuantepe, he is in a relationship and has two small children. He has been driving a mototaxi for eight years. His biggest dream is to be able to make improvements to his house. At the moment, he is using zinc sheets as walls.

He is requesting this loan to buy gravel, bricks, cement and iron. With this investment his children will be safer and their quality of life will improve. He wants to thank Kiva and Afodenic for the support they are giving him through this loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Kareema

texts.en:
Kareema is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son appears in the photo.

Kareema is a 58-year-old, married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and two children; a son and a daughter. For the past eight years, Kareema's son has operated a small barber shop in the city. He loves his job and he would like to improve it. 

Kareema took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her son develop his barber shop and buy all the needed items for his work, like beauty products. By taking this loan, Kareema's son will be able to improve his business and also his income.

loans.use: to help her son develop his barber shop and buy all the needed items for his work, like beauty products.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

He will use the KES 10,000 loan to add to his stock of shoes. His business goal is to expand business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will create employment. He also does farming to earn an extra income.

loans.use: add stock of shoes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Elizabeth has been in this business for four years now.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her general store. Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 35 years old and is married with three daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She has run a general store at her house for three years. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery and some household electrical goods. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

Phuong hopes her business will run smoothly which will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of products, such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu, 41, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a security guard. 

Thu started a business of making clothes ten years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of fabric and a sewing machine to make better clothes to sell at her store and to better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Virginia Clara

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de chompas, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia teje diferentes tipos de modelos de chompas a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lanas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Virginia Clara, continues to earn her living selling sweaters, which she's been doing for years.  Thanks to the effort she puts into her business on a daily basis it's been going well.  She knits assorted styles of sweaters per client orders.  She's a very responsible person.

Virginia Clara wants to be able to keep working so she can continue to support her family.  She's seeking a loan to buy wool yarn for her business.  She's grateful for the loan and promises to keep up with her payments.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn for her business.

loans.name: Fima

texts.en:
Fima is 56 years old and married with two children.

Fima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Fima has been in this business for twenty years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Fima aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jonas Koffi

texts.fr: Jonas Koffi âgé de 45 ans est marié à une marchande du nom de Rosine. Le couple à deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jonas Koffi vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Jonas Koffi a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Jonas Koffi est un pêcheur, activité qu'il exerce depuis treize ans. Ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Jonas Koffi vend des crevettes. Jonas Koffi s'approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Jonas Koffi sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Jonas Koffi is 45 years old and is married to a saleswoman named Rosine. They have two children, both of whom attend school at their expense. The couple shares the household expenses. Jonas Koffi went to school at primary level. Jonas Koffi has been a fisherman for 13 years. This activity enables him to provide for his family. On the sideline he sells shrimps. He buys his stock locally. Hoping to satisfy his customers, Jonas Koffi requests a fourth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To buy shrimps.

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина жизнерадостная  трудолюбивая женщина. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Мадина живет с мамой. Она предоставляет услуги швеи. Она шьёт как национальные платья, так и европейские платья. Мадина этим бизнесом занимается уже более 2 года. Она привлекает постоянных клиентов благодаря упорному труду. Мадина является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее мама пенсионерка. Мадина должна провести мероприятие, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Madina is a cheerful, hardworking woman.  She's divorced, doesn't have children, and lives with her mother.  She provides sewing services, making things like traditional and European dresses.  She's been in business for more than two years and thanks to her tireless work she attracts steady clients.  Her mother is retired, so she's her family's main breadwinner.   

Madina has to arrange an event but doesn't have enough money.  She's seeking a loan for 5000 soms to hold the event.  She awaits your beneficence  and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to hold an event.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 35-year-old single woman; she has two children. She describes herself to be determined and loyal to her customers. 

She operates a retail business where she sells animal feed. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of enough capital. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add a stock of animal feed. 

Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of animal feed

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
This is Margarita, 52, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married and has children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Margarita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Margarita hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Oyun is 63 years old and lives with her husband in their apartment in Bulgan province, Mongolia. Her husband Mart works at a local shopping center as doorman. Her children are married and live apart. 

Oyun has been farming pigs, poultry and cow for years and sells her organic dairy products at the local market. She has just started her clothes retail business in the local market. She is a very hardworking, enthusiastic and positive woman who is now requesting loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase clothes inventory to sell at her rental stall at the local market. She has opened a time deposit under her children's names with a low amount and is trying to save some money for her children for their brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes inventory to sell at her rental stall at a local market

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia Maritza se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de cuyes,la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años,el sueño de ls socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cuyes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Maritza continues to work in her guinea pig raising business.  She fattens them as they grow and later sells them in different markets.  She works from 8 am to 4 pm, and has been in this business for many years.  Her dream is to expand her guinea pig selling business.  She is seeking a loan to purchase guinea pigs.  She is very happy for the loan and she is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 42 and single, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Anh earns money through her business selling snacks, drinks, and also clothes. 

Anh would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of different products to sell during the holiday season, such as beers, sugar, and noodles to increase her sales and meet her customers' needs. 

She also hopes her business will ensure that she will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, beer, and noodles to sell during the holiday season.

loans.name: Lac

texts.en:
Lac is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. 

This purchase will help her better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. 

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en: Jovita lives at Amulung with her spouse and two children. She has been a fish and vegetable vendor for a year now. She only gets minimal income from this kind of business but she patiently manages it to get ahead in life. She joined ASKI and is now borrowing a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more tomatoes, eggplant, cabbages and fish to sell. She hopes to increase sales capacity and keep extending good products and services to all her customers.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, eggplant, cabbages and fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family.

She has a pottery making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Ma. Luisa is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

Ma. Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her pottery business.

loans.name: Joaninha

texts.en:
Joaninha is taking a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. Joaninha opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $400.00.

She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as oil, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, candles, soap, and rice. Joaninha is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it is offered for poor people to improve their living condition in the future.

loans.use: To buy oil, noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, candles, soap, and rice

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Aged 43 years, Chorn is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four children; two are in school. 

She earns a living through rice farming and growing cassava, which she had been doing for 25 years. She can earn about KHR 95,000 per day from her current business. 

This is the first loan for Chorn with VisionFund; she is going to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. 

This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Vicente Agustin

texts.es:
Vicente tiene 26 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con el esposo y con sus hijos de 2 y 4 años en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos
Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Vicente se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para los insumos que necesita para la agricultura como  abono, insecticida,  fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. Las compras  lo realizan en Ventanas. Su  sueño es comprar un terreno. El desafío al que se enfrenta es las plagas del maíz. En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar, ver televisión y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Vicente is 26 years old, lives in a common-law marriage and has a 2-year old and a 4-year old.  They live in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.  He is a member of "30 de Noviembre", a communal bank located in Mina de Piedra, a community in the Ventanas canton.  The members work in agriculture and livestock breeding.  

Vicente works planting corn.  He is seeking a loan for the supplies he needs for his crops such as" compost, insecticide, fertilizers, urea and fungicide.  He will make the purchases in the town of Ventanas.  His dream is to purchase a plot of land.  The challenge he faces is corn pests.  In his free time, he enjoys relaxing, watching television and playing sports.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and compost for growing rice.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is married and the mother of six children, two of whom are adults while four still attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She earns a living by making various food items for her neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 10,000 to buy more food and cooking items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, charcoal sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establishing a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to buy food and charcoal.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Ella es adriana, estudia auxiliar judicial en campo alto, de acuerdo a la oportunidad que le dieron con el descuento para estudiar el primer semestre; ella fue motivada a estudiar más para obtener excelentes resultados y de esa manera retribuir con las notas a dicho descuento.

Se vieron los resultados ya que fue la mejor de la clase y realizó muchos aportes positivos a los compañeros; de esta manera ganó respeto y admiración demostrando que con empeño y dedicación se logran buenos resultados.

A nivel familiar le sigue dando un ejemplo claro a los hijos que el estudio es la base fundamental del futuro y que las oportunidades se deben aprovechar para seguir superándose, con esto los motiva día a día a no desaprovechar el estudio, con la creencia que es el único regalo que nadie les quitará y es la mejor herencia que se les puede dejar a los hijos.

En el trabajo le sirvió para reafirmar los conocimientos básicos que tiene sobre derecho y de esa manera pudo sostener con más confianza y argumentos conversaciones que antes no podía por ignorancia en ciertos temas.

Para el siguiente semestre tiene por meta seguir ocupando el primer puesto y poder seguir aportando a la clase; de manera que los compañeros y docentes puedan sentirse orgullosos del progreso de toda la clase. 

Ella aspira poder ubicarse laboralmente en la carrera que estudia para seguir creciendo como persona y seguir aprendiendo cosas nuevas, el convenio de kiva seria bueno para ella, para que a si pueda seguir con los estudios, aprende cada dia mas  y terminar siendo una de las mejores en la carrera.
texts.en:
This is Adriana, she is studying to be a court clerk in Campo Alto.  She was given the opportunity to attend with a discounted first semester.  She was motivated to study hard to get good grades and therefore make up for the discount with her good grades.  

Her handwork showed as she was at the top of her class and was able to make positive contributions to her classmates.  This helped her to gain respect and admiration by demonstrating that with effort and dedication, one can achieve good results.  

In terms of her family, she continues to provide her children with a clear example that education is the foundation of their future and that they must take advantage of opportunities to better themselves.  She motivates them everyday to not waste their education, with the belief that it is the only gift that cannot be taken away from them, and it is the best inheritance that she can give them.

At work, it has helped her to reaffirm her basic knowledge of the legal field, which allowed her to be more confident in arguments and conversations than she was able to be before as she was lacking in certain subjects.  

Next semester, her goal is to remain at the top of her class and to continue to contribute to her class in a way that makes the students and teachers proud of the class's progress. She hopes to be able to make a career in the field that she is studying so she can continue to grow as a person and continue to learn new things.  

The Kiva loan would be a good thing for her so that she can continue with her studies, learn more everyday and become one of the best in her field.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Greta Yohana

texts.es: Doña Greta, es docente en una escuela, madre soltera de dos hijos de 15 y 25 años a quienes apoya para su educación siendo esta su prioridad principal para que ellos sean hombre de bien con ideales y puedan ayuar a la sociedad, doña Greta desea realizar la construcción de su porche en su vivienda para obtener más espacio en su hogar para su familia, solicita el crédito para comprar los materiales como cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, solamente gracias al financiamiento a largo plazo doña Greta podrá realizar esta obra ya que sus ingresos como docente son muy pocos.
texts.en: Greta is a school teacher. She is a single mother with two sons aged 15 and 25, who she supports so that they can focus on their education. She wants them to be good men with ideals who can help society. Greta wants to build a porch to give her home more space for the family. She is asking for a loan to buy materials such as cement, sand, iron and concrete blocks. It is only thanks to this loan that she will be able to carry out this work as she earns very little as a teacher.

loans.use: to buy materials such as cement, sand, iron and concrete blocks.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano es un grupo que está formando parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas están recibiendo capacitaciones para poder crecer y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Cayetana, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, la cual motiva siempre a sus compañeras a poder seguir creciendo y esforzarse cada día más por mejorar. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que se dedica a la venta de ropas, también se debe destacar el gran esfuerzo que ella está haciendo por ir superando su pobreza
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The 'San Cayetano' group is part of the Poverty Stoplight Program, where everyone receives training about how to grow and improve their quality of living. One of the members is Cayetana who is the president of the group. She always motivates her companions to continue to grow and each day work to be better.  She tells us that amongst the work she does, she sells clothing. She has to do this with a lot of effort as she is trying to work her way out of poverty. She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of clothing which she will re-sell. Which will help her fulfill her business plan and help her increase her revenues.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 52-year-old, married man from Jericho city. He lives with his wife and four children (two sons and two daughters) in a small, simple house in the city. For the past few years, Sameer has operated a small barber shop in the city. He loves his job and he would like to improve it. 

Sameer took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to develop his barber shop and buy all the needed items for his work, like beauty products. By taking this loan, Sameer will be able to improve his business and also his income.  

Sameer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to develop his barber shop and buy all the needed items for his work, like beauty products.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio Julio Cesar, él socio continua dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio a la vez continua trabajando en una empresa de seguridad, él socio es una persona responsable, siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes y alimento para sus animales.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar works raising small animals like guinea pigs.  He has been in the business for a long time, and it has been going well for him thanks to the effort he puts into it every day.  He also works for a security company.  He is a responsible person, which is the reason why he has been able to get ahead.

He is seeking a loan to purchase guinea pigs and food for his animals.  He is grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs and feed for his animals.

loans.name: Irenge Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Buhendwa est une commerçante depuis 2 ans, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 étudient  et 1 qui est encore gosse. La cliente est membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Irenge ». Elle est vendeuse de friperie. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant des divers. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle compte accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants et construire une jolie maison. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, en leur accordant de crédit  sans garantie matérielle et surtout, pendant ce moment de conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays
texts.en: Buhendwa has been a saleswoman for two years. She is 35 years old with four children of whom three go to school and one is still an infant. This client is a member of a business association called  « Irenge ». She sells secondhand clothes. She requests a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She will buy one bale of clothing. Her husband also sells various products. She started her business with money that her husband gave her. In the future, she hopes to increase her capital, educate and feed her children and build a nice house. She thanks Hekima for their help to women in business that are excluded from the traditional banking system, by granting them a loan without tangible security and above all, during this time of conflict in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to buy one bale of secondhand clothes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Bo Elie

texts.fr: Bo Elie âgé de 35 ans est marié à une marchande du nom de Chantal. Le couple à quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Bo Elie vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Bo Elie a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire mais a appris l'électronique par la suite. Activité qu'il exerce depuis seize ans. En dehors de son activité, de façon secondaire, Bo Elie achète DVD et des cassettes qu'il revend dans son atelier. Bo Elie s'approvisionne au Nigéria. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Bo Elie sollicite pour la cinquième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Bo Elie is 35 years old and married to a saleswoman named Chantal. They have four children, some of whom attend school at their expense. Bo Elie lives with his wife and children. The couple shares the household expenses. Bo Elie attended school to the secondary level, but went on to study electronics. He has been in this business for 16 years. On the side he has a parallel business of buying and selling DVD's and cassettes in his workshop. Bo Elie buys his stock in Nigeria. Hoping to satisfy his customers' demand, Bo Elie requests a fifth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To buy electronic parts.

loans.name: Mathias

texts.fr: Mathias âgé de 33 ans est marié à une couturière du nom de Babine. Le couple à deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et un à leur charge. Mathias vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Mathias n’a pas fréquenté l'école mais a appris la photographie, activité qu'il exerce de depuis vingt-deux ans dans son atelier. En dehors de son activité, Mathias achète des pellicules, des cadres, des cassettes et des CD qu'il revend dans son atelier. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Mathias sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mathias is 33 years of age and is married to a seamstress named Babine. The couple has two children, one at school and one under their care. Mathias lives with his family and children, and together the couple provides for their household.

Mathias did not go to school, but learned to be a photographer, a business he has run from his workshop for 22 years. In addition to this business, he also buys film, frames, cassettes and CDs, which he resells in his workshop. In order to meet customer demand, he has requested financial support from Alidé for the fourth time. All of Mathias' prior loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy film, cassettes, frames, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Isolina

texts.es:
Blanca de 59 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada desde hace 38 años; su pareja es panificador y agricultor tuvieron en común 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno vive con ellos, pues son hogares aparte. Con ella, solo viven 2 nietos  de 10 años y 6 están estudiando básica. 

Blanca aprendió hacer el pan desde que estaba muy joven, tiene 19 años  de dedicarse a la panadería decidió hacer esa actividad porque no encontró otra forma de ayudar a su familia de ella a salir adelante y colaborar en los gastos de la casa. Con su esposo,  pusieron su propio puesto de panadería antes se dedicaban a vender pan, pero lo compraban hecho. Hoy en día ellos lo producen, va a comprar los insumos a la ciudad, recorre 34 kilómetros, paga transporte para hacer llegar hasta la casa de ella los insumos.

El préstamo será  invertido en la compra de insumos harinas, azúcar, miel, entre otras. El préstamo mejorara su negocio porque tendré la oportunidad de satisfacer la demanda del pan, es bastante en el municipio la necesidad a satisfacer será la de tener un mejor ingreso, para su familia y mejorar la alimentación diaria.

Desea seguir haciendo pan y poner mis propias tiendas de pan en todo el municipio donde vive, su sueño es producir pan para exportarlo, pues considera que lo elaboran muy rico. Su sueño para su familia es que ellos vivan mejor teniendo una vida digna.

La ganancia de su negocio,  al tenerla le gustaría comprar otro horno para panificar y que la producción abunde más.
texts.en:
Blanca, 59, did not go to school. She has been with her life partner for 38 years. He is a baker and farmer, and they have four children, who live in their own homes. Blanca's two grandchildren, ages 10 and 6, live with her and are in elementary school.

Blanca learned bread making as a child. When she was 19, she decided to do this for a living because she couldn't find any other way to help her family and to share the household expenses. She and her husband opened a bakery. They used to sell bread that was baked by others. Now they make the bread, buy the ingredients in the city, which is a 34 kilometer trip, and pay to have the supplies delivered to their house.

She will use this loan to buy flour, sugar, honey, and more. The loan will aid her business because it will give her a chance to meet customer demand for bread, which is significant in her town. She will earn more money for her family members and provide better food for them. Blanca wants to keep making bread and to open shops throughout the town where she lives. She dreams of exporting her product because it is delicious. She hopes that her family has a better, dignified life. She would like to use her profit to buy another baking oven so that she can produce more.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, honey, and more items for her bakery.

loans.name: New Bidii Group

texts.en:
New Bidii is a Nuru International group comprised of two farmers in Kuria, West District in Kenya. The members joined the group to acquire skills and knowledge about improved farming methods and are able to obtain loans through Nuru to acquire farm inputs. As a group, the members of New Bidii collectively guarantee their loan. Ronald, pictured holding a piece of paper on his hand, is the representative of the group. He is 32 years old and married with four children who all go to school. He has been a group member since 2012. 

Ronald will use his portion of this group loan to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer which he believes will increase his farm yields. Just like other members of his group, he will take input loans for one acre and grow maize on 1/2 acre and sorghum and millet on a ¼ acre each. Ronald will obtain food for his household as well as be able to sell his surplus crop and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie earns a living by operating a business where she serves a variety of meals to customers in her village. For the last six years, she has earned a good income for her family and successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC that she used on their farm. She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell in a cafeteria. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Adalaida

texts.en:
Adalaida chose this organization for borrowing a loan because she knew of its good service. Adalaida runs a general merchandise store, selling electrical supplies within her village. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an electrician, which is why she chose this type of business. 

Adalaida would like to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy electrical supplies like light bulbs, wires, circuit breakers, and wiring devices. She thinks that her requested loan will be a great help and support for the growth of her business. Adalaida believes that she could improve her financial stability so she could educate her children and have a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies like light bulbs, wires, circuit breakers, and wiring devices for electronic sales

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en:
Jacquiline, age 46, operates a variety store to earn a living. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Jacquiline lives in Tanza, Cavite, with her husband Reynaldo and their children. Reynaldo earns an income as a farmer. Jacquiline and Reynaldo manage their household while operating their businesses, and they work hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jacquiline is requesting a Php9,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Jacquiline dreams of expanding her variety store and hopes to give her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Flor Beatriz

texts.es:
Flor tiene 30 años de edad estado civil soltera vive con sus hijas de 12 y 1 año en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos 
Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Flor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales . Solicita el crédito para los insumos que necesita para la agricultura como  abono, insecticida,  fertilizantes, urea, fungicida además alimento para los animales balanceados. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. El sueño es comprar un terreno. El desafío al que se enfrenta es trabajar mucho más. En su tiempo libre le gusta compartir con su familia.
texts.en:
Flor is a 30 year old single mother who lives with her two daughters, who are 12 and 1, in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.  She is a member of the "30 de Noviembre" communal bank which is located in the Mina de Piedra community in the Ventanas canton.  The members work in agriculture and animal husbandry.  

Flor works in agriculture, planting corn and raising animals.  She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies needed for agriculture such as: manure, fertilizer, urea, fungicide, and balanced animal feed.  She will make the purchases in Ventanas.  Her dream is to purchase a plot of land.  The challenge she faces is to work much more.  In her free time, she enjoys being with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides and animal balance feed.

loans.name: Cinamula Group

texts.fr: Madame   Joséphine est  conseillère du groupe CINAMULA. Agée de 52 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle sollicite un prêt de 200$ pour acheter  125kgs d’haricots à 100$ et 50kgs de café à 100$. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutient aux femmes et pense agrandir son entreprise par le cumul d’épargne qu’elle  se constitue à partir des différents crédits reçus.
texts.en: Joséphine is an advisor of the Cinamula group. She is 52 years old, a widow and mother to four children who have all been to school. She is requesting a loan of $200 to buy 125kg of beans for $100 and 50kg of coffee for $100. She is grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to women and is thinking of expanding her business with the accumulated savings she makes from the different loans she has received.

loans.use: to buy 125kg of beans for $100 and 50kg of coffee for $100.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
 
Mwanamkuu has operated a milk-selling business at the market for the past five years, selling to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase gallons of milk for resale. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in society.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of milk for resale.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal, age 40, is an experienced farmer from a rural village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. To add to her current income, Phal also sells coconuts in her community. Her earnings usually support food, home expenses, school allowances for her children, and other costs. She has a big family that is comprised of 11 members including her.

Phal doesn't have a motorcycle to help her with transportation, so everyone in her family has to pay for taxi service in order to get to their workplaces. Phal would like to minimize this cost by purchasing a motorcycle. However, she has insufficient funds to make this possible. That’s why she is asking for a loan of 800 USD to buy a motorcycle for personal use.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Augustin Dossou

texts.fr: Augustin Dossou âgé de 34 ans est marié à une couturière du nom de Delphine. Le couple à deux enfants, dont un scolarisé et aucun à leur charge. Augustin Dossou vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Augustin Dossou et sa femme, assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Augustin Dossou a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau primaire. Augustin Dossou est un vulgarisateur, activité qu'il exerce depuis huit ans dans sa région, ce qui lui permet de répondre aux besoins de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Augustin Dossou vend des pneus, des chambres à air et des accessoires de vulgarisation dans son atelier. Augustin Dossou s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Augustin Dossou sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Augustin Dossou, aged 34, is married to a seamstress named Delphine. The couple have two children, of whom one is in school with neither in their care. Augustin Dossou lives together with his wife and children. He and his wife jointly cover diverse household expenses. Augustin Dossou has a primary school education. He is a "vulgarisateur", a job he has been in for eight years in his region. This enables him to respond to family needs. On the side, he sells inner tubes, tires, and tire accessories in his workshop. He gets his supplies from a city in Benin. With the goal of satisfying customer demands, Augustin Dossou is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time.

loans.use: to purchase inner tubes, tires, and accessories for his business

loans.name: Marc

texts.fr: Marc âgé de 44 ans est marié à une marchande du nom de Céline. Le couple à trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Marc vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Marc a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au niveau secondaire, mais a appris l'électronique par la suite, activité qu'il exerce depuis quinze ans dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Marc à une buvette. Marc s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Marc sollicite pour la quatrième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Marc, aged 44, is married to a merchant named Céline. The couple have three children, not all in school but all in their care. Marc lives together with his wife and children. The diverse household expenses are covered by the couple. Marc has a middle school education, but he then learned about electronics, which has been a business of his for fifteen years in the region. On the side, he has a refreshment stand. He gets his supplies from a city in Benin. With the goal of satisfying customer demands, Marc is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the fourth time. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to purchase electronics parts and beverages to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26 years old single young man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. For the past two years, Ahmad opened a small barber shop in the city. He loves his job and he would like to improve it. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to develop his barber shop and buy all the needed stuff for his work like hair-care products. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to improve his business and also his income.  

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to develop his barber shop and buy hair-care products

loans.name: Rabecca's Group

texts.en:
Rabecca is the Kiva representative for Sibanga, a group of six farmers in Chwele District. Rabecca volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and leader to help more farmers. She is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised. The loan will allow for farming inputs to be delivered to her and the sixty-four other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will receive an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Rabecca is married and has four children. She is thirty-five years old and is known for being hardworking and reliable. She is active in her community, including in the women's group. Rabecca has been a farmer for ten years. She described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 
 							
Rabecca joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. She joined One Acre Fund to be exposed to new farming methods and earn enough money to feed her family. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Rabecca's life because she has earned more profit from her harvest, which enabled her to feed her family.  

Rabecca and the Sibanga Group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to farmers as they repay One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
This group has six farmers in the Chwele District with Isaac selected as the Kiva representative. Isaac is on the right in the photo with his hand raised. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.	

Isaac is married and has eight children.  He is 58 years old and is known as hardworking, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group and the burial committee. Isaac has been a farmer for 46 years. He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

Isaac first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 long rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods and earn enough income to send his children to school. 

He volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Isaac plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send children to school and repair his home.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Isaac’s own life improved because he has more profits from his harvest, has more farm training and was able to save money. 	

Isaac's Group needs a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  The loan will go toward the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. Farming materials will be delivered to him and the 65 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings each.

One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Gulzara

texts.ru: Гулзаре 53 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей- 4 девочки и 1 сын. 2 девочки-замужем, проживают отдельно, 2 дочери в России на заработках, работают в ресторане-посудомойщицами. Ежемесячно высылают часть зарплаты на родину в Кыргызстан родителям для поддержания семьи. А младший сын проживает с родителями и помогает им по хозяйству. Супруг у Гулзары -пенсионер. У Гулзары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулзара занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулзары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулзара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку одной коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулзара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Gulzara is 53 years old, married, and together with her husband has brought up five children - four girls and one son. Two of the girls are married and live separately. Two daughters are in Russia for work, working in a restaurant as dishwashers. Monthly they send a part of their pay home to Kyrgyzstan to her parents to support the family. And the youngest son resides with his parents and helps them around the homestead.

Gulzara's husband is retired. Gulzara has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Gulzara is involved in raising livestock, having begun 15 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Gulzara today has on her homestead: one dairy cow. Monthly income consists of 3,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her homestead, Gulzara turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase one cow for further increasing the count of cattle.

Gulzara plans to invest income from the loan to further propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for improving the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy one cow

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar is 38 years old, married, and has two children, who attend school. He lives in a small house in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His wife used to run a small clothing store and now works at a local kindergarten as an assistant teacher. 

Erdenebaatar is a caring and thoughtful father and husband who works very hard for his family and sons' future. Huvsgul province has many tourist attraction landscapes and resorts and Erdenebaatar decided to purchase a second-hand vehicle to start providing tour guide/driver services. He has been driving public transportation inter provinces for years and has lot of experience and skills. He is requesting loan for 2,300,000 MNT, which he will use to purchase a mini-van to start his tourist guide/driver business.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-van to start his tourist guide/driver business

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
La socia Aurea se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros,la socia ya tiene 9 años en este negocio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de autopartes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar autopartes como faros y espejos para carros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Aurea continues earning her living in the business of auto parts sales. She has been in the business for nine years, and she works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. 

Aurea's dream is to expand her auto parts business. She is requesting the loan to purchase car parts like headlights and mirrors. 

Aurea is happy about this loan and she promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts like headlights and mirrors.

loans.name: Hopital Kyeshero Group

texts.fr: Le Client Munyondo  est un Infirmier, dans une structure médicale gérée par une église pentecôtiste, ce client est un doyen, âgé de 67 ans et père de 9 enfants, dont 1 continue à étudier et les 8 autres, ont déjà terminé leurs études. Il sollicite un prêt auprès de l’IMF Hekima pour améliorer son mieux être et faire ses affaires de commerce. Sa conjointe est une spécialiste dans l’art culinaire (Maitre cuisinière). Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir pour lancer un nouveau business. Au finish, il remercie fortement Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux personnes exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle,surtout;  pendant, cette période post conflit dans la région de l’Est du Pays.
texts.en: The customer, Munyondo is a nurse in a medical structure which is managed by a Pentecostal church. He is an elder, who is 67 years old and father to nine children, one of whom is still studying while the eight others have already completed their studies. He is requesting a loan from IMF Hékima to improve his well being and carrying out his commercial activities. His wife is a specialist in culinary art (a master chef). This new loan will allow him to set up a new business. Finally, he is extremely grateful to Hekima for the support it provides to people who cannot access the classicl bank system, and above all for providing loans without material guarantees, during this post-conflictual period in the eastern region of the country.

loans.use: to use for setting up a new business.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mapenzi Group

texts.fr:
Madame Rusagara  âgée de 55 ans est présidente dans le groupe Mapenzi. Mariée à un maçon constructeur et a 11 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle sollicite ce  crédit pour acheter 3 sacs de souliers ainsi renforcer son commerce. Son objectif est d’augmenter son capital, agrandir son entreprise  et construire une belle maison. 
Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en: Rusagara, who is 55 years old, is president of the Mapenzi group. She is married to a builder and has 11 children all of whom have been educated. She is requesting this loan to buy three bags of shoes to boost her business. Her aim is to increase her capital, expand her business and build a lovely house. She is grateful to Hekima for its support to poor women who are economically active.

loans.use: to buy three bags of shoes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: M. Hanif

texts.en: M. Hanif is 46, energetic and lives with his three children in Lahore, Pakistan. He supports a sibling as well; his father raised buffaloes and passed his herd on to his son. M. Hanif earns a living by selling milk in his community. He also produces yogurt and butter for his family's personal use. He has three buffaloes and milks them twice a day. He sells milk in front of his house and also sells by going door to door. He is single and responsible for all household expenses. His main challenges are a rapid increase in both inflation and in household expenses. M. Hanif requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy an additional buffalo so he has more milk to sell. He will use some of his profits to buy fodder. He hopes that his production will increase and that he can easily cope with inflation. M. Hanif thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for their assistance.

loans.use: to buy an additional buffalo to make more milk.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 4 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Maria Auxiliadora 4 está en su ciclo número 7º del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, lo que destaca a estas señoras es la unión que demuestran, ya que siempre trabajan juntas, pues el deseo de poder superarse es muy grande.
Integra este grupo la Sra. Maria, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, se destaca por ser una persona muy trabajadora, que pone siempre su mayor esfuerzo por ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Se dedica a la venta de joyas de variadas clases, y por medio de ese trabajo tiene los ingresos que necesita para poder ayudar a su familia, y esta vez pide de este préstamo para poder comprar joyas, que le permitirá poder seguir creciendo y continuando con sus ventas. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas reciben de formar parte de este programa de comités.
texts.en:
