The group known as "Maria Auxiliadora 4" is in their 7th loan cycle of the Woman's Committee Program where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. What makes these women stand out is the unity they display as they always work together. Their desire to get ahead is great.

Maria is a member of this group and also the president of the group. She is a hard-working person who always puts in her best effort in order to improve her life and that of her family. She sells different kinds of jewelry and through this work has the revenue she needs to to help her family. She is requesting a loan to to buy jewelry which will allow her to continue growing and selling her product. She is grateful for the opportunity being offered to the whole group that makes up a part of the Woman's Committee.

loans.use: to buy a variety of jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.es: Tatiana joven de 26 años de edad con un futuro por delante, vende cosméticos por catálogos de manera independiente y su esposo labora como pintor automotriz, ambos procrearon un bebe, su mayor inspiración para  luchar y salir adelante. Tatiana solicito un primer crédito el cual invirtió en ropa y cosméticos, ahora cuenta con un poco mas de productos, en esta segunda oportunidad de crédito que requiere igualmente lo utilizara para comprar perfumes, vanidades, shapoo, cremas para el cuerpo, lociones, entre otros productos para el cabello. Esta inversión le permitirá progresar con su pequeño negocio incrementando las ventas, que le ayuda a mantener sus gastos en conjunto con el apoyo de su esposo.
texts.en: Tatiana is 26 years old and has her whole future ahead of her. She sells cosmetic products out of catalogues. She works independently while her husband makes a living painting vehicles. Together the couple has a baby, their biggest motivation to fight to get ahead. Tatiana used her first loan, to invest in clothes and cosmetics. She now has a few more products and, with this second loan, she would like to buy perfumes, shampoos, body creams, lotions and more hair products. This investment will allow Tatiana to move forward with her little business and increase sales. This will help her to cover household costs with her husband's support.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, shampoos, body creams, lotions and more.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao is 58 years of age and an experienced farmer from a rural area of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She is engaged in a farming business with help from her husband and children. She has more than one hectare of farmland, where she manages to grow rice and other crops seasonally. Having been in the business for over 30 years, she is able to earn an income of 5 USD per day on average. Her husband, who helps her with the farming work, also works as a construction foreman to add to the family's income.

At this time, Pao is asking for a loan to buy a motorcycle to enable her husband and some of her employed children to get to work. By using their family-owned motorcycle, they will avoid paying the high cost of taxi service. Through this purchase, everyone in the family can gain access to suitable transportation. She expresses thanks to all lenders who have contributed their funds to help her better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for family members to commute to work

loans.name: Bunheang

texts.en:
Bunheang is 39 years old, married, and has five children. Three of his children help him earn income by working in various positions for a garment factory in Phnom Penh. As other local villagers, Bunheang is engaged in a farming business. The earnings generated from farming are barely enough to cover his daily costs, so he started a traveling sales business selling soft drinks, coffee, and green tea to make additional income. Bunheang has been a farmer for many years and a seller for five years.

Bunheang would like to acquire a loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to buy wallboard to replace a deteriorated wall in his home. As a hard-working father, Bunheang hopes that his business will continue to become more profitable and hopes to provide his family all the best he possibly can.

loans.use: to buy wallboard to replace a deteriorated wall.

loans.name: Poeun

texts.en:
Poeun is 61 years old and married. She has three grown children, and two of her children have their own families. Poeun manages a business planting and harvesting rice twice a year on her own land, which is located in Kampong Thom province. Her husband and children assist her greatly in her everyday farming work. She has been involved in this occupation for more than 25 years. 

To be able to continue her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Poeun is asking for a loan of 1,200 USD to buy seeds and fertilizer to apply to her crops. She expresses her thanks to all lenders for helping her sustain her agribusiness, so that her finances are more stable.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math is 34 years of age and an experienced farmer from a rural village of Baray district, Kampong Thom. He currently lives with his wife and child. To meet the needs of his family, Math works hard every day with farming activities and maintains his crops from the challenges of insects and weeds. With the help of his family members, Math manages on about one hectare and half of farmland, where he grows rice and cassavas. Farming is the main source of his family's income. 

As his cassavas are fully grown, Math needs to hire local laborers to help him harvest and collect cassavas, but he has insufficient capital to cover the costs. That’s why he is asking for a loan, which will enable him to pay for harvesting services. Math appreciates the financial support offered by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Bahrom

texts.ru: Бахром 38-летний житель района Дж.Руми, занятый в отрасли сельского хозяйства. В данный момент он планирует начать бизнес по животноводству. Поскольку Бахром знает как разводить скот он решил построить на этом прибыльный бизнес. У Бахрома при дворе дома имеется старый сарай, где он будет держать скот. А разводить скот он будет на местном пастбище. Кроме того, у него имеется орошаемый участок земли, с которого он уже собрал двести вязок кукурузной травы и сто вязок люцерны, высушил их и запасся кормом на зиму. Чтобы закупить двух бычков и начать бизнес, Бахром просит кредит. Он хочет улучшить условия жизни семьи и поэтому планирует совмещать земледельческую деятельность с животноводством. Он очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Bahrom is a 38-year-old resident of the J.Rumy region, engaged in agriculture. Currently, he is planning to begin a business raising livestock. Since Bahrom knows how to rend cattle, he decided to build on this lucrative business. In the courtyard of his house, Bahrom has an old barn where he will keep the cattle, and he will graze the cattle on a local pasture. In addition, he has an irrigated plot of land, from which he has already collected 200 bundles of corn grass and 100 bundles of alfalfa, dried them and stored them as feed for the winter.

In order to buy two steers and to start a business, Bahrom is requesting a loan. He wants to improve living conditions for his family and therefore plans to combine farm work with the livestock. He very much hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy a pair of steers to start a livestock business

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Хафиза молодая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась в 1987 года. Хафиза замужем. Она мать 5 детей. Хафиза вместе семьей живет на Северной части Таджикистана. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес шитьем и продажей женской одежды. Она умеет шить как национальные платья, так и европейский стиль одежды. Хафиза планирует открыть свой цех и предоставить свои услуги на высшем уровне. Хафиза запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для покупки швейной машинки, и оплатить за аренду помещения.
texts.en:
Hafiza is a young and cheerful woman. She was born in 1987. Hafiza is married. She is the mother of five children. Hafiza lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan. She wants to establish her own business sewing and selling women's clothing. She knows how to sew both national dresses and also European style clothing.

Hafiza plans to open her own workshop and to provide her services at the highest level. Hafiza is requesting a loan of US$1,500 to buy a sewing machine, and to pay rent on a location.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and to rent a location for organizing new business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Ali from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. He is married with 4 children.  For the past 7 years, Ali established his shoe business. He began his business because he was not educated formally so he decided to join in to trading. He works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to her business lack of enough capital to run her business.

Ali requires a loan in order to buy slipper, shoe, and crape to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and start a savings account. In the future; Ali plans to renovate his business structure and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy slipper, shoe, and crape to expand his business

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Meet 34-year-old Osman from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. He is married with 2 children.  In 2008, Osman established a building material business. He began his business because he wants to generate a permanent source of income to support the home. He works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of enough capital to run the business.

Osman requires a loan in order to buy zinc, cement, iron rods and head pans to expand his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and pay his children's school fees.  In the future, Osman plans to employ staff and open another outlet. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy zinc, cement, iron rods and head pans to expand his business.

loans.name: Emely Yohana

texts.es:
Emely en una joven con muchas fuerzas, deseos y ganas de superarse y de salir adelante a sus 21 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad y dependen de ella y su esposo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completa gracias al apoyo incondicional de sus padres mismos que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy temprana edad especializándose en la siembra y cultivo de maíz y frijol. Junto a su esposo sigue trabajando en la agricultura en el mismo rubro la siembra de granos básicos ya que él también es agricultor y comerciante dedicándose a la venta de pescado fresco en su comunidad. Sus clientes para la venta de granos básicos son las bodegas e intermediarios y para la venta de pescado familiares, amigos, vecinos y demás compradores que adquieren un producto con calidad. Sus cultivos de maíz y frijoles están ubicados a una distancia de 20 minutos desde su casa de habitación al cual se trasladan en vestía o caminando involucrándose en este rubro únicamente ellos dos.
Sus planes a futuro poder construir su propia casa de habitación, para con sus hijos apoyarlos en todo lo necesariamente posible para que ellos no pasen por la misma situación que ella ya que el trabajo de campo es pesado, algunas veces riesgoso que de no tratar a tiempo y dar el mantenimiento necesario se puede perder la cosecha completa.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que dará asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de maíz y frijol para que al final de la temporada obtener una excelente cosecha la cual pueda vender a un muy buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Emely is a young person who has a lot of strengths, desires, and the will to succeed and get ahead.  At 21 she is the mother of 2 minor children who depend upon her and her husband.  She completed an elementary school education thanks to the unconditional support of her parents.  Her parents also taught her to work the land from an early age, specializing in the cultivation of corn and beans.  Along with her husband, Emely is continuing to work the land, cultivating staple grains.  Her husband is a farmer and is also a merchant, selling fresh fish in their community.  

Emely sells her grains to the warehouses and wholesalers, and she sells fish to relatives, friends and neighbors, and to other buyers who want her quality products.  Her corn and bean fields are located 20 minutes from her house, and she gets there on a mule or by walking, and only the two of them are involved in this work.  In the future, Emely plans to build her own house so that she can support her children in every way possible so that they don't end up in the same situation she did, because agricultural work is hard, and at times risky.  If the crops are not given treatments on time and the maintenance they need, it is possible to lose the whole harvest.

Today, Emely is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies to support and maintain her crops of corn and beans so that she will get an excellent harvest at the end of the season, enabling her to sell her products at a very good price in the market.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her corn and bean crops

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is a 25-year-old single mother. Upon finishing school she found it difficult to find stable work, was unemployed for long periods at a time and held odd jobs that paid low wages.  She is ambitious and determined.  She enjoys selling energy-efficient products like fuel-efficient cook stoves and solar lighting products in slums around Nairobi through the iSmart distribution network, as she knows these products help to improve lives.  Her biggest challenge is not having enough capital to buy enough products to sell.  She will use this Kiva loan to buy more stoves and solar lamps to sell, and an agent toolkit that includes a uniform and tools that will help her business.

loans.use: To purchase clean energy technologies to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a young resident of the Kawangware slum. He does not have any parents and has spent much of his childhood days in welfare organisations for street youth.  He was previously involved in crime, had repeated periods of unemployment, and had taken odd jobs on the street for extremely low wages.  He describes himself as ambitious and determined.  He now sells eco-friendly products such as solar lamps and fuel-efficient cookstoves in slums around Nairobi.  He will use the loan to buy more stock to sell so that he can earn a decent wage and help his community.

loans.use: To purchase clean energy technologies to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a young resident of the Kawangware slum.  After completing school he found it difficult to find a job that paid a decent wage, and he went through many jobs in the informal sector.  He now sells eco-friendly products such as solar lamps and fuel-efficient cookstoves in slums around Nairobi.  He will use the loan to buy more stock to sell so that he can earn a decent wage and help his community.

loans.use: To purchase clean energy technologies to sell

loans.name: Lilian's Group

texts.en: Esther is a young single mother who resides in Kawangware.  Due to the lack of jobs available, she has experienced long periods of unstable employment and has been in and out of low-paying jobs.  Like Esther, Lilian and Wycliffe are also young residents of the Kawangware slum and have very similar stories.  They all aspire to become business owners and are currently selling energy-efficient products like solar lamps and fuel-efficient cook stoves around other slums in Nairobi.  The group will use the loan to buy more stock and an agent toolkit that will help them to sell to their communities. They look forward to earning a decent wage to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase clean energy technologies to sell

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en: Nicolas is a young resident of a slum in Nairobi.  When he was a child he was beaten by his father so much that he ran away from home.  He spent much of his childhood living under bridges, washing cars, and roaming.  Like Nicolas, Stephen, Mercy, and Eunice also come from similar backgrounds and now reside in an informal settlement in Nairobi called Kawangware. They are all passionate about becoming business owners and currently sell environmentally-friendly products such as solar lamps and fuel-efficient cookstoves to their communities and other slums in Nairobi. Their biggest challenge is not having enough capital to buy stock to sell. The group will use the loan to buy more inventory so that they can earn a decent wage and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase clean energy technologies to sell

loans.name: Baatarhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Baatarhuu is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and three children in their ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. His wife Enhtuvshin helps her husband to run their family business of wooden furniture manufacturing on their plot of land. His three children attend a local public school and kindergarten.
 
Baatarhuu started his wooden furniture manufacturing business in 2005 at home. He has gained a lot of experience and has manufactured large amounts of furniture with a variety of designs by order. He has built his reputation of producing high quality, well-designed furniture. He is now requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to stock up on seasonal inventory for his business. He is a hardworking and reliable man who has good previous loan records with XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
This is Marissa, 30, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is Joerlito, a driver, and they have child. She and her partner manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marissa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 20,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marissa hopes to have a grocery store someday, and dreams of having a better living.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 26 years old, a very hardworking gentleman, married and a father of one who supports a family of five. He has been employed in the motorcycle transport business for the past four years with a monthly income of about KES. 18,000. 

He learned about Vision Fund Kenya from some of his colleagues who are funded by the organization.

Joseph has acquired his first loan of KES. 87,880, which will facilitate him to purchase his own motorbike. He is likely to earn more, due to the increased flexibility, and already established a customer base.

He plans to use the proceeds to repay his loan, as well as boost his savings account. 

He hopes to buy another motorcycle from his accumulated savings. He is an industrious gentleman who is determined to achieve his goal and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his business

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es:
José tiene 38 años de edad  estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa y sus hijo de 2 y 3 años en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
José se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de maíz y arroz.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos y para dar mantenimiento especifico a sus siembras.
Vende sus productos en Ventanas. El sueño es mejorar su vivienda. El desafío que se enfrenta  el mal tiempo. En el tiempo libre le gusta estar con su familia y viajar.
texts.en:
José is 38 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his wife and their son in Ventanas, in the province of Los Ríos. He is a member of the "30 de Noviembre" communal bank, which is located in the rural community of Mina de Piedra, also in the canton of Ventanas. He earns his living in farming and livestock production. 

José grows corn and rice. He is requesting this loan to purchase supplies and to perform specific maintenance on his crops. 

José sells his products in Ventanas. His dream is to improve his house, and the challenge he faces is bad weather. In his free time, he likes to spend time with his family and travel.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting corn and to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Galo Andres

texts.es:
Galo tiene 49 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en el Cantón  Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Galo se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas. Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno para la siembra además alimento para los animales balanceados.  Las compras realiza en el  Cantón Ventanas en el  Comercial  García. Su sueño es comprar un terreno para el cultivo para no arrendar. El desafío que enfrenta es  el trabajo contra la maleza. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte y caminar por el campo.
texts.en:
Galo is 49 years old. He lives in a common-law marriage with his wife and two children in Ventanas canton, Los Rios province. He is a member of the "30 de Noviembre" communal bank located in the Mina de Piedra village, part of Ventanas canton. He farms and raises animals. Galo grows corn and raises chickens. 

He is requesting the loan for the lease on the land he plants on and also to buy balanced feed. He'll buy the goods in Comercial Garcia in Ventanas canton. His dream is to buy a plot of land so he doesn't need to rent. His challenge is the fight against infestations. In his free time he likes to play sports and walk in the country.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to grow corn.

loans.name: Caren Herlinda

texts.es:
Caren  tiene 22 años de edad es soltero vive con los abuelitos en el Cantón  Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Caren se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maíz. Solicita el crédito para la siembra de arroz, maíz y lo necesario en la agricultura como la semilla y el abono.   Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Los desafíos que se enfrenta es presencia de mucha lluvia. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear en el pueblo y las fiestas de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Caren is 22 years old, single and lives with her grandparents in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province.

Caren is a member of the "30 de Noviembre" communal bank in the Mina de Piedra area, which is part of the Ventanas canton. The people here work in the agricultural and livestock sectors.

Caren works in agriculture, sewing rice and corn. She is applying for this loan in order to sow rice and corn and to buy necessary agricultural supplies such as seeds and manure. Caren makes her purchases in Ventanas. Her dream is improve her living conditions. One challenge that Caren is facing is heavy rains. In her free time, Caren likes to go out in the local town and to local parties

loans.use: to buy fertilisers.

loans.name: Mirian Janeth

texts.es:
Mirian tiene 35 años de edad de estado civil Casada tiene tres hijos vive con el esposo en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.  
Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Mirian se dedica a la siembra de maíz y crianza de gallinas. Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y fertilizantes para los cultivos para evitar las plagas y enfermedades. Las compras se realizan en el comercial Montenegro en Ventanas. Su sueño es mejorar la producción de los cultivos. El desafío que enfrenta es las malezas. En su tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar.
texts.en:
Mirian is 35 years old, married and has three children. She lives with her husband Mina de Piedra area of the Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

Mirian is a member of the "30 de Noviembre" communal bank in the Mina de Piedra area, which is part of the Ventanas canton. The people here work in the agricultural and livestock sectors.

Mirian makes a living sowing corn and raising hens. She is applying for this loan to pay the rent on her land and to buy fertilisers for her crops, in order to avoid plagues and diseases. Mirian will make her purchases in Montenegro, in Ventanas. Her dream is to improve crop production. The challenge that she faces is tackling weeds. In her free time, Mirian likes to go out walking.

loans.use: to buy manure and seeds for sowing corn and rice.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer appreciates Kiva and Yehu for their financial support that enabled her pay school fees.  She still operates her beauty salon.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase shampoo, hair oil, and renovate her house.

She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair oil, and renovate her house

loans.name: Jimmy Miguel

texts.es:
Jimmy tiene 37 años de edad vive en Union libre tiene dos hijos vive en en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias.

Jimmy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz suave. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves.

Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquir algunos insumos.El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas. 

La meta es tener dienro para ahorra y con eso salir de viaje a otro pais. Cuando tiene tiempo libre le gusta domir mucho.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 37 years old and lives with his partner. The couple has two children and the family lives in the Mocache canton, in the Los Ríos province.

Jimmy is a member of the "27 de octubre" communal bank in the Sara Guerrero area of the Mocache canton. Here the people work in the agricultural and livestock sectors.

Jimmy works in agriculture, growing corn. He makes his purchases on Thursdays at the Mocache market.

Jimmy has been able to cover some costs, such as paying labourers and buying some supplies. He has applied for this loan in order to buy fertilisers, manure and seeds.

Jimmy's goal is to have enough money to save up and travel to another country. When he has spare time, Jimmy likes to sleep a lot.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school and one is still too young to attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For more than five years, she has operated a business selling fruits such as bananas, oranges, mangoes, watermelon and others. She sells from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase oranges, bananas and mangoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase oranges, bananas and mangoes for resale

loans.name: Clerah

texts.en:
Clerah is a business woman who is very hardworking and enterprising. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Clerah practices crop farming as a business and she has been in this business for the past 10 years.She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pipes for irrigation. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is from Yerevan. She lives with her parents and studies at Yerevan State University. Gayane's father is a shoemaker and her mother is a sales woman in the store. 

Gayane is in her third course of study. Her parents work hard to provide a better life for her, and it is very difficult to save money for Gayane's university.

By applying for this loan, Gayane asks for financial support to pay her university tuition. 

She will be very grateful to lenders for support, and the opportunity to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is 40 years old. He has a wife and five children, ages 14, 12, 10, 8, and 6. He has two other children who he cares for; their father died. He is basically involved mostly in maize and potato trade. He is also involved in agriculture. He began the business to be able to get money for upkeep. He will use the loan to do maize trade. He hopes to expand the shop to sell all the different kinds of cereals in the near future. His main challenge is bad weather. He is hard working. In the photo, Robert is on the left and the Ugafode credit officer is on the right in Robert's maize garden during field verification.

loans.use: To buy maize for resale

loans.name: 7 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El comité “7 de agosto” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de una comunidad de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité hacen actividades rurales, ya que son de zonas rurales, lejanas de la zona céntrica de esa ciudad.
Todas se dedican a la cría y venta de animales de corral, como ser gallinas, cerdos, ovejas y demás.  Angela, pide de este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, lo que le permitirá seguir con la cría de sus animales.
texts.en: The “7 de agosto” [August 7] communal bank comprises a group of neighbors from the city of Santaní. All the members work at agricultural activities, as the area is rural and far from the city center. They all raise and sell barnyard animals like laying hens, pigs, and sheep. Angela has applied for a loan to buy feed so that she can continue to raise her animals.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Tem is 57 years old, married, and has five children. He runs two business ventures at the same time, farming rice and fishing, which he has been doing for over 30 years. To be able to take care of his family, Tem works hard every day these activities. His wife assists him in his daily farming chores and his sons help him with fishing. 

To help him further develop his current businesses, Tem is requesting his eighth loan for 4,000,000 KHR, which he will use to buy seeds, fertilizer, and fishing materials.  With the increase in his earnings, Tem will improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and fishing materials.

loans.name: Jumonazar

texts.ru: Чумоназар веселый мужчина из района Шахритус. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. Чумоназар как и большинство жителей Таджикистана решил заняться животноводством. Не только в Шахритусе, но и во многих районах деревнях и селах основной деятельностью является растениеводство и животноводство. Чумоназар не стал от них отставать и тоже решил начать свой бизнес по выращиванию крупно рогатых скотов у себя дома. Опыта работы у него нет, но есть огромное желание заниматься такой деятельностью. У Чумоназара есть родные и близкие, которые всегда ему помогут. У него есть все условия для обоснования такого бизнеса, он обзавелся коровником и корма для скотов. У него есть начальный капитал, но для начала такого бизнеса ему не достаточно. Он решил взять кредит и начать собственный бизнес. На сумму от кредита он купит бычков и начнет бизнес.
texts.en:
Jumonazar is a jovial man from the Shahrituz region. He is 35 years old. He is married. Jumonazar like the majority of residents of Tajikistan chose to engage in raising livestock. Not only in Shahrituz but in many areas, the main activity of the villages and countryside is raising crops and livestock. Jumonazar did not keep away from them and also decided to start his own business in rearing cattle at his home. He does not have experience in this work, but he has a huge desire to engage in this kind of work. Jumonazar has relatives and close friends, who always help him. He has all the conditions for rationalizing such a business. He has acquired a barn and feed for the livestock.

He has starting capital, but in order to start such a business it is not enough. He decided to take a loan and to start his own business. With the loan amount, he will buy steers and start the business.

loans.use: to buy steers and to start a business raising livestock

loans.name: Dania María

texts.es:
Doña Dania María es originaria del municipio de El Sauce donde ha vivido toda su vida, se casó con un Sauceño y procreó tres hijos de los cuales los tres están estudiando una en la universidad y dos en secundaria.
Doña Dania es una mujer muy activa que desde muy joven se gana la vida negociando como comerciante, con la ayuda de su esposo que le regaló un pequeño capital para invirtiera en lo que tanto le ha gustado hacer comercializar prendas de oro y plata y cosméticos el cual es su negocio principal.
Ella se levanta desde muy temprano a alistar a sus hijos para el colegio y luego sale de manera ambulante a pie a visitar a sus clientes para sus posibles ventas.
Tiene 17 años de dedicarse a este negocio el que le ha permitido superarse económicamente y ayudar a su esposo en mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda.
Doña Dania en este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito, ya que tiene gran demanda de sus clientes por la temporada de Diciembre donde hay festividades por lo que quiere invertir en cosméticos y productos de limpieza.
Confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva apoyen su solicitud.
texts.en:
Dania María was born in El Sauce, where she has lived all her life. She married another resident of El Sauce, and they have three children, one of whom is in college and two are in junior high school. Dania has always been active. She makes her living as a merchant with her husband's help, as he gave her money to invest in a business that she loves, selling gold and silver jewelry and selling cosmetics, her main business. She gets up early to get her children ready for school and then walks to customers' houses to try to make sales. She has been running her business for 17 years, and it has allowed her to earn sufficient income and to help her husband improve their living conditions. 

Dania now needs a loan to meet customer demand during the December holiday season. She want to buy cosmetics and cleaning supplies. She trusts in God that the Kiva lenders will provide the funding.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Mrs. Zoya is a 65-year-old woman who goes back and forth between Arkhangai province and Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her children got married and live apart from her. She helps her children by babysitting her grandchildren while running her business. 

She sells a variety of products to Arkhangai residents and she also barters her products for meat and dairy. Soon she wants to sell that to Ulaanbaatar city customers at a higher price. Her daughter helps her to run her business and imports clothing inventory from Erlian, China and she also does that herself. She is a very hardworking and tough woman who raised all her children all by herself, after her husband passed away about a decade ago.
 
She is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory to continue running her business successfully. She has good previous loan records at XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to continue running her business successfully

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 46 años de edad, está casada y tiene 04 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. El negocio de Rosa consiste en la venta de gaseosas que realiza en su casa propia, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora donde guarda sus productos a temperaturas frías como le agrada a sus clientes, se animo a iniciar su negocio hace 06 años, contando con la ayuda de sus hijos en la atención de los clientes cuando ella está fuera de casa. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico con el cual apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, ya que con el sueldo de vigilante de su esposo no les alcanzaba, logrando aumentar su capital y reinvirtiendo en su negocio. Por lo contario, comenta que no le gusta cuando llueve muy seguido pues eso hace disminuir sus ventas. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1200, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. El  monto solicitado los invertirá en la compra de gaseosas al por mayor, para así obtener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, who is 46 years old, is married and has four children with whom she lives in the house that they own. 

Rosa's business consists of selling soft drinks, which she does in her house. She has a refrigerator where she keeps her products at cold temperatures, the way her customers like them. She was inspired to start her business six years ago, with the help of her children in serving customers when she is out of the house. What she likes about her business is having an income with which she can help her husband with the household expenses—since his security guard salary doesn't cover everything—while still managing to increase her capital and reinvest it in her business. On the other hand, she says that she doesn't like it when it rains frequently because that reduces her sales. 

At this time, Rosa is requesting 1,200 nuevos soles (PEN); she is waiting for this small loan in order to be able to reach her objectives. For her part, she promises to make her loan payments punctually. She will invest the requested amount in the purchase of soft drinks at wholesale, so that she can obtain a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks at wholesale

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna works hard to support her family. Paterna is married and has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines.

Paterna requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Paterna has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Paterna would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Tujikaze Group

texts.fr: La cliente Chirimwami est une commerçante depuis 4 ans et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Tujikaze», âgée de 30 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants  dont, 2 étudient et 3 sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse des souliers. Elle étale son activité dans la rue dans un quartier animé. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 150 paires de souliers usagers. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est  commerçant. Elle avait commence avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, pendant la période difficile des conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Chirimwami has worked in retail for four years, and is a member of the Tujikaze business group. She is 30 years of age, married, and a mother to five children (two at school and three babies). She works in the street selling footwear in a lively part of town, and has requested a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She plans to buy 150 pairs of used shoes.  

Chirimwami's husband is also a retailer, and she started her business with funds she received from him. In the future she would like to buy a plot of land, as well as to educate and feed her children. She is truly grateful to Hekima for the support it gives to women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system, providing them with loans without collateral during these hard times of conflict in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy 150 pairs of used shoes

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Yet, 44, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. She is married and has nine children, two of whom are still in school. For the last 26 years, Yet has been growing cassava while her husband is a fisherman. They can earn about 31,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Yet joined VisionFund for her first loan. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and to use a portion of it to spend on labor costs. She hopes to make more income from her rice paddy to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Digna

texts.en: Digna is 30 years old, married and has a child. Her family lives at Amulung. She is a simple housewife and a hog grower. Her spouse is a farmer too. She wants to keep nourishing her hogs but has insufficient funds. She is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed and rice bran to keep her hogs healthy upon reaching their optimum growth. Through sustaining her hogs with complete hog feed, she can sell them at a greater price.

loans.use: to buy feed and rice bran for her hog raising business

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou operates a junk shop business in her village. Her daily routine is to go around her village to buy used bottles and scraps which will serve as her source of income. 

She has run her business for five years and she is proud to share that, through her income, she is able to provide her two children allowances for going to school. Her eldest child already finished college.

Marilou wishes to have good health and to manage her business well. Marilou admits that she doesn’t have enough capital to buy more junk, thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy bottles and scrap. 

She will spend her income on her youngest child's education and on household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy bottles and scrap for her recycling business.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed grocery items for her variety store. Her loan also helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her partner are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Isabel dreams that her business will last a long time and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 38 years old and the married father of three. He lives in Mwingi and earns a living for his family by selling shoes. He is married to Rose who helps him in the business. Their children are 9, 7 and 3 years old. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Due to limited income he has been unable to expand his business. That is why he decided to request a loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to purchase more shoes for sale.

This will expand his customer base which will increase his sales and increase his profits. With the additional income he will earn, Johnstone will save for his children’s education and repay his loan. In the future, Johnstone wishes to purchase a piece of land and build a permanent house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 35 years old and he lives in Dilijan city. He is married and he has two children. Robert together with his wife is engaged in farming. In their farm they have four bulls and five beehives. His farm cattle are kept in a barn he built on his own. He sells meat and honey. The honey that he sells from his farm is very pure and tasty; he already has many regular customers, who buy only honey from his farm during spring and autumn seasons.  

Robert is asking for a loan of 250,000 Armenian drams in order to buy hay for his farm cattle, since he is very worried that the hay he gathered during autumn will not be enough to last the whole winter period.

loans.use: to buy hay for his farm cattle

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis tiene 62 años de edad vive en Union libre tiene dos hijos de 18 años y de 14 años de edad vive en en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz suave y a la crianza de pollos. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves.

Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquir algunos insumos.El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas y balanceado de crianza y engorde para los pollos.

La meta es tener dinero para seguir trabajando en la agricultura. Cuando tiene tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte
texts.en:
Luis is 62 years old, is in a common law marriage and has two children, ages 18 and 14.  He lives in the Mocache neighborhood, within the Los Rios province.

The area is called 27 DE OCTUBRE and is located in the Sara Guerrero part of the Mocache settlement.  The people here farm and raise livestock.

Luis is a farmer and raises soft corn and chickens.  He makes his purchases on Thursday at the Mocache fairs.

He has been able to cover some of his needs with the money, such as paying for labor and acquiring some supplies.  He is asking for this loan to buy fertilizers, compost, seeds, and feed for his chickens.

His goal is to have money to continue working in farming.  He likes to play sports in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a businesswoman who operates various businesses such as a retail shop, a motorcycle business and selling clothes. She is grateful for her previous loan that enabled her to purchase another motorbike and thus increase her monthly income.

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to add more household consumables such as wheat flour, cooking oil, salt, sugar, and soap to her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to add more household consumables such as wheat flour, cooking oil, salt, sugar, and soap to her business

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, a sus 53 años de edad, es padre de 2 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
Hace aproximadamente 20 años comenzó a trabajar en el gremio de pintores automotrices, oficio que aprendió con un amigo, luego comenzó a trabajar en un taller y allí obtuvo su experiencia y complementó sus conocimientos pero, con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos, decidió independizarse y montó su propio taller de comercialización y entonación de pintura automotriz, allí trabaja de lunes a sábado de 8 am a 6 pm y, a pesar de las dificultades que tuvo para acreditar su negocio y posicionarlo en el mercado, ya lleva 9 años en funcionamiento, generando los ingresos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en el mantenimiento de los equipos de trabajo y en el refuerzo de inventarios (pinturas, laca acrílica, entre otros), esto le permitirá mejorar la calidad de su trabajo y ofrecer buenos productos a sus clientes, satisfaciendo sus gustos y necesidades, así podrá aumentar sus ventas y el nivel de utilidades que recibe por su labor.
Francisco manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener su negocio en un local propio y continuar realizando su labor para así seguir apoyando a sus hijos para tengan la oportunidad de realizar estudios universitarios y se conviertan en profesionales idóneos.
texts.en:
Francisco, at 53 years old, is a father of two children which he has raised with much effort. About 20 years ago he began working in the trade of automotive painters. He learned the craft from a friend. Later he began to work in a garage and there he obtained experience and supplemented his knowledge, but with the aim of improving his income, he decided to go independent and start his own workshop in the market of automotive paint. There he works from Monday to Saturday from 8 am to 6 pm, despite the difficulties of having to accredit his business and position it in the market. It's already been functioning for 9 years, generating sufficient income to sustain his household.
The loan requested will be invested in equipment maintenance and to strengthen inventories (paint, acrylic lacquer, etc.) This will allow him to improve the quality of his work and offer good products to his customers, satisfying their tastes and needs so he will be able to increase his sales and the level of  profit that he receives for his labor.
Fancisco says that his great dream is to have his business in his own location and continue doing his work to support his children so that they have the opportunity to go to university and become qualified professionals.

loans.use: to do maintenance on work equipment and strengthen inventory (paint, acrylic laquer, etc.)

loans.name: Zebinisso

texts.ru: Трудолюбивая сельская женщина Зебиниссо живет в районе Кубадиён. Ей 51 год. Она занимается земледелием и выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры на 0,15 га участке земли. Зебиниссо намеревается открыть бизнес по откорму и продаже скота и совмещать его с земледельческой деятельностью. Она планирует выращивает молодых бычков в течение 30-35 дней и затем продавать их по прибыльной цене на том же скотном рынке, откуда она будет покупать. Для реализации задуманного целя Зебиниссо просит кредит, так как собственного сбережения не хватает. Она хочет купить четыре голов молодых бычков. Конечно в этом новом бизнесе ей будет помогать семья. Для ведения данного бизнеса у нее созданы все условия. Осталось только закупить скот и Зебиниссо с надеждой ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
The hardworking, rural woman Zebinisso lives in the area of Qubadiyon. She is 51 years old. She is engaged in agriculture and grows crops on a 0.15-hectare plot of land. Zebinisso intends to open a business in fattening and selling cattle and to combine this with her farming activities. She plans to raise young steers over the course of 30-35 days and then to sell them at a premium at the same livestock market where she will buy them.

To reach her planned goals, Zebinisso is requesting a loan, as her own savings are not enough. She wants to buy four heads of young steer.

Of course, her family will help her in the new business. She has created all the conditions for running this kind of business. It remains only to purchase cattle and Zebinisso hopefully awaits the support.

loans.use: to buy four young steers for starting a business by fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
Ñepytyvo  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona de difícil acceso, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo lentamente.
La Sra. Maria es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a las ventas de comidas saladas entre otras variedades, la cual  sale también a vender en otros lugares sus comidas. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de todas las personas de su zona puedan ir mejorando su entorno y así ofrecer una mayor seguridad a sus familias, también poder procurar para ellos un mejor futuro.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de más insumos para su venta, como ser carne, pollo, jamón, queso, panificados, y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo con su negocio y dar así a su familia lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Ñepytyvo" is in its second loan cycle with the Program of Women's Committees.  This group is from the city of Concepcion, in a growing area located a bit outside the downtown.  This is a difficult area to get to, and so the members of this group are struggling to grow their businesses and give the area where they live a better atmosphere and make it grow.

Maria is one of the members of this group.  She has a business selling salty foods and other items.  She goes out to other places to sell her food.  She hopes that over time, and with the help of all of the people in her area, the environment in her area will improve so their families will be more secure and will be able to have a better future. 

Maria is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for her business, such as: meat, chicken, ham, cheese, bread, and other products.  In this way, she can continue to grow her business and give her family what they need to have a life without hardship.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business

loans.name: Nounh

texts.en:
Nounh is 30 years old, married, and a loving mother of two school-going children. She lives with her family in Ang Snoul district, Kandal province. To earn a living, Nounh and her husband manage a general store, selling different kinds of products in front of a factory. Her frequent customers are factory workers and local people in the region. She has been doing this for nearly four years.

She would like to apply for a loan of USD 1,000 to buy different products such as food ingredients, noodles, beverages, sweets, biscuits, and other miscellaneous household products. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and help her children in their education. For her future plans, she will grow her business bigger and secure the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy different products such as food ingredients, noodles, beverages, sweets, biscuits, and other miscellaneous household products.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel es una joven de 34 años originaria del municipio, madre de dos hijos menores de edad.
Se desempeña como conserje en un colegio de la localidad donde tiene más de diez años de laborar.
Aunque gana muy poco con costo para los gastos del hogar ejerce su actividad con esmero donde desde las cinco de la mañana empieza a realizar la limpieza de las aulas de clase de un colegio para que a las siete de la mañana la hora que entran los alumnos los salones ya estén limpios.
Es un trabajo cansado pero agradece a Dios por tener este trabajo digno el que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a sus hijos.
Está solicitando un crédito para compra de medicamentos, realización de exámenes y ultrasonidos para su hijo menor que últimamente ha estado enfermo y con su salario no ajusta para estos gastos que son de emergencia.
Espera y confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva apoyen su solicitud a través de Ceprodel donde necesita de esta mano ayuda porque ella es una de las tantas personas de escasos recursos de Nicaragua.
texts.en:
María Isabel, 34, was born in El Sauce and is the mother of two children. She has been working as a janitor at a local school for 10 years. Though her job pays little, she does it conscientiously. She starts cleaning the classrooms at 5 a.m. so that the rooms are clean a 7 a.m., when the students arrive. The work is tiring, but she thanks God for a decent job that allows her to provide for her children every day.

She has applied for a loan to buy medication and to pay for exams and ultrasounds for her youngest son, who has been sick recently. Her salary doesn't cover these emergency expenses. She hopes and trust in God that the Kiva lenders will provide this funding though Ceprodel, as she is one of many low-income Nicaraguans who need their help.

loans.use: to buy medication and pay for exams and ultrasounds.

loans.name: Modeste Tonahin

texts.fr: Modeste Tonahin âgé de 35 ans est marié une marchande du nom de Rosaline. Le couple à trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et aucun à leur charge. Modeste Tonahin vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Modeste Tonahin n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Modeste Tonahin est un ajusteur aiguiseur, activité qu'il exerce depuis treize ans dans sa région. Modeste Tonahin s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Modeste Tonahin sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Modeste Tonahin is 35 years old and married to a saleswoman called Rosaline. They have three children, some of whom attend school at their expense. The couple shares the household expenses. Modeste Tonahin lives with his wife and children. Modeste Tonahin did not go to school. He has been a sharpener operator for 13 years in his region. Modeste Tonahin buys his stock in a town in Benin. Hoping to satisfy the demand of his customers, he requests a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was repaid correctly.

loans.use: To buy a sharpening machine.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en: Dilrabo is a hard-working woman. She was born in 1983. She is married and has three children. Dilrabo has a specialized education and works in a school as a teacher. Dilrabo wants to get a higher pedagogical degree. With this aim, she entered the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. Dilrabo’s husband is a welder and he has little income and can’t support Dilrabo's education. Dilrabo is asking for a loan to pay for tuition at the university. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Chrep

texts.en:
Chrep, aged 41, is a widowed woman with four grown-up children, two of whom are still students. Chrep devotes herself to a farming business, growing rice in Rokhak Kiri district, Battambang. She has been in the farming business for more than 19 years and it is the main source of her income. 

Chrep has an unhygienic latrine at home, so she would like to request a loan to buy materials and to pay for labor costs for the construction of a latrine. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited, Chrep is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to pay for labor and materials to build a latrine

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 55 years old and married with nine children. 

Epefania is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Epefania requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Epefania has been in the pig-fattening business for one year now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Epefania would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Asifiwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mateene est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaires « Asifiwe », entrepreneur, dynamique, responsable, âgée de 37 ans, veuve et mère de 4 enfants dont qui étudient et 1 encore bambin.                  La cliente est une vendeuse des planches de constructions. Elle stocke sa marchandise dans un dépôt sur la route principale. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari (lors de son vivant). Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 2 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 70 planches. Ainsi, elle souhaite étendre son projet et devenir grossiste, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique poste conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Mateene works as a retailer, and is a member of the Asifiwe business group. She is a 37-year-old entrepreneur who is dynamic and responsible, and is a widowed mother of four children (one of whom is at school and one still a baby). She works selling wooden boards for construction, and gets her stock in a warehouse on the main road. 

Mateene started her business with help from her husband, while he was still alive. Later, she benefited from a loan given to her by the Hekima microfinance institution. She has been working in this business for two years, and this new loan will allow her to buy 80 wooden boards. She hopes to be able to expand her business and become a wholesaler, as well as to provide her children with education, clothing and food. Mateene is extremely grateful to Hekima for allowing female entrepreneurs without access to traditional banking to become more autonomous, especially during this critical post-conflict period in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy 70 wooden boards

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Javanson

texts.en:
Javanson is a 37-year-old father of two from Embu and runs a barber shop business. He also offers laundry services to supplement his income. He is married to Florida who is also in business. Their children are 8 and 3. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

This marks his first loan with VisionFund Kenya. With the loan, he will be able to purchase new shaving machines and also pay his children’s school fees. Additional income created will be reinvested into the business. 

In the future, Javanson would like to build many rental houses. He hopes to give his two children the best education possible.

loans.use: to purchase new shaving machines and also pay his children’s school fees

loans.name: Riccy Miriams

texts.es:
Riccy tiene 40 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 
Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Riccy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz y maiz. Solicita el crédito para la compra  de insumos agrícolas. Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y tener una buena producción. Los desafíos que se enfrenta son las plagas y las enfermedades falta de capital para trabajar. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir al pueblo a pasear y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Riccy is 40 years old and is in a common-law marriage. She has two children and lives with her partner and children in the Mina de Piedra precinct in the Ventanas canton of the Los Ríos province. She belongs to the '30 de noviembre' loan group located in the Mina de Piedra precinct in the Ventanas canton, where residents make a living from agricultural work and livestock. 

Riccy makes a living from agriculture, growing rice and corn. She is asking for the loan to buy agricultural supplies. She will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas. 

Her dream is to have good health to keep working and have a good production. The challenges she faces are plagues, diseases and lack of working capital. In her free time she likes to explore the town and to play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy is requesting a new loan to buy more paint products to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more paint producs for selling

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loand, she wants to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Miguela Francisca

texts.es:
Miguela tiene 37 años de edad vive en Union libre tiene tres hijos vive en en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias.

Miguela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz suave. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves.

Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquir algunos insumos.El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas y una bomba para fumigar. 

La meta es seguir produciendo mas productos para tener mayores ingresos. Cuando tiene tiempo libre le gusta escuchar musica en muy alto volumen.
texts.en:
Miguela is 37 years old. She lives with her partner and has three children. She lives in the Mocache canton belonging to the Rios province.

The community bank is called 27 of October. It is found located in Sara Guerrero district belonging to the Mocache canton. They are dedicated to agricultural and livestock work. 

Miguela is dedicated to farming, sowing soft corn. She makes her purchases in Mocache in the market on Thursdays.

With the money, she has been able to cover some necessities like paying laborers and acquiring some resources. The loan requested is to buy fertilizers, seeds, and a fumigation bomb.

Her goal is to keep producing more products to have greater income. When she has free time, she likes to listen to music at a loud volume.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and a fumigation bomb.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is from Jermuk town in the Vayots Dzor region. She lives there with her husband and 16-year-old daughter. Her husband is a teacher with many years of experience working at the local village school. Siranush, as a housewife, takes care of her daughter and household and also has been involved in agriculture. She runs a farm which includes six cows and calves and 15 colonies of bees. Siranush gets honey which is in high demand among nearby resellers because of its good quality. Agriculture helps Siranush and her husband to cover their basic needs so the income from farming is very important.
Siranush has requested this loan to be able to increase her livestock with two more cows and forage for feeding them. She had taken out a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, both Siranush and her husband  are able to ensure that they will be able to cover the monthly payments of the new loan. 
Siranush has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Boota

texts.en:
Boota is a 39-year-old, energetic man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. His siblings are still young; his father has grown old and does not have a job. All Boota's efforts are for providing comfort to his parents and his siblings.

Boota is a milkman by profession; he sells milk to customers and bull calves to the butcher. He has been doing this business for many years and earns a reasonable income for his family. He has a few buffaloes, which he milks twice a day. He provides door-to-door milk service to his customers and collects money on a monthly basis. 

Boota is confident that he can increase his herd through breeding. His current buffaloes produce milk and he does not have any other buffalo to use for breeding. He has increased his herd through breeding in the past, as he has now acquired sufficient experience in the breeding system. However, due to lack of funds, it seems impossible to buy an additional buffalo because a healthy buffalo is expensive. Therefore, Boota has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy an additional buffalo for breeding. He wants to continue his breeding system in the future, because he can easily increase his herd and generate more income through milk production. 

Boota thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo for breeding.

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar de 29 años de edad, es reconocido por su carisma y su don de gentes, es un hombre trabajador que siempre vela por el bienestar de su familia.
Desde muy joven se involucró en el campo de la construcción, trabajando como ayudante de su padre, con quien aprendió y obtuvo experiencia en el oficio. Actualmente trabaja de manera independiente, es contratado para realizar diferentes labores y sus principales clientes son conocidos y referidos, no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido, pues cada contrato es diferente y se debe adaptar a los requerimientos de su clientela.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de herramientas de trabajo (brochas, rodillos, espátula, almadana, cincel, escuadras, regletas, entre otros), esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y le facilitará la ejecución del mismo, logrando satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, esto le ayudará a incrementar los ingresos con los cuales solventa los gastos básicos de la casa en la que vive con su esposa.
Oscar manifiesta que su proyecto para un futuro a mediano plazo es poder adquirir su casa propia y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: Oscar is 29 years old and known as a charismatic people-person. He's a hardworking man who always looks out for his family. Since he was very young he's worked in the construction field, and got experience and learned the trade by working as his father's assistant. Currently he's self-employed and is contracted for different types of jobs, and his best customers are acquaintances and referrals. There's no fixed work schedule, because each job is different and he must adapt to his customers' requirements. The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of work tools (brushes, rollers, a scraper, a sledgehammer, a chisel, carpenter squares, power strips, among other things) which will improve work conditions and make the job itself easier while meeting the needs of his customers.  This will help him increase the income that he uses for he and his wife's household expenses. Oscar states that his medium-term goal for the future is to obtain a house of his own and secure his family's well-being and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase work tools (brushes, rollers, a scraper, a sledgehammer, a chisel, carpenter squares, power strips, among other things)

loans.name: Huyen

texts.en: Huyen is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. These purchases will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo renacer, forma parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, mediante el cual quieren poder superarse e ir mejorando las condiciones de vida de cada una.
Zunilda, quien es una de las integrantes de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de ropas, es una persona ejemplar, por el esfuerzo que pone por crecer. Su familia es su fuerza y por quien ella lucha. Pide este préstamo, ya que quiere comprar prendas variadas, con las cuales podrá surtirse y seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: "Renacer" [Reborn] communal bank is participating in the poverty reduction survey, which helps people succeed and raise their standard of living. Zunilda, one of the group members, sells clothing. She is role model for the effort she puts into personal growth. Her family is her support and what she strives for. She has applied for this loan to buy a variety of clothing to stock her business and keep selling.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josefa Benita

texts.es:
Josefa Benita es una señora de 54 años, madre soltera de una hija, originaria del municipio de El sauce ubicado al occidente de Nicaragua.
Se siente muy orgullosa de ser natal de este pueblo maravilloso lleno de bondades naturales que a pesar de quedar alejado del bullicio de la ciudad se siente la paz y tranquilidad lo que hace que las personas se sientan contentas.
La profesora chepita como generalmente todos la conocen en El Sauce por cariño es una maestra con un gran carisma que muchos la quieren por ese gran don que tiene.
Le tocó criar sola a su hija y con su salario de maestra le ha dado lo mejor que ha podido, hoy se siente satisfecha porque su hija ya egresó de la carrera universitaria y en este momento tiene la necesidad de un crédito para la promoción y la tramitación del título.
Solicita a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le financien este crédito para llevar a cabo su inversión donde le quedará eternamente agradecida
texts.en:
Josefa Benita is 54 years old and is a single mother to her daughter. She is from the town of El Sauce, which is located in the western region of Nicaragua. Josefa is proud to be a native of El Sauce, and she loves her peaceful, tranquil town with its abundant natural resources and beauty. Josefa is a beloved, well-known teacher in El Sauce, and her students refer to her by the nickname "chepita."  

As a single mother, Josefa has done the best she can to raise and support her daughter on her modest teacher's salary. Her daughter recently graduated from university, and Josefa now needs to pay off her tuition and education costs. Josefa is grateful for this opportunity and to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to cover residual tuition and higher education costs.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is 53 years old, married and has three children. Her main goal is to uplift their living condition. Her husband is a farmer, planting and growing rice crops on her rice farmland. 

Ludy helps her husband in generating income through managing her tailoring business. She usually does repairing and sewing of garments within her locality. 

Ludy wants to expand her business scope and earn a higher income to enable her to provide her children’s allowances for school. With regards to this matter, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy fabrics, thread, and other related materials for tailoring. She believes that the loan will enable her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, and other related materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Mukbilshoh

texts.en: Mukbilshoh is a man who always tries for the well being of his family. Mukbilshoh lives with his wife and two children in a rural area, near the mountains.  Mukbilshoh’s parents live with him. His wife is a housewife, who has been busy with the up bringing of their children. Mukbilshoh has been busy with a transportation business for more than two years. Mukbilshoh transports goods from the center of the region to his rural area. He knows his business well.  His son is ill.  Doctors must to operate on him, but Mukbilshoh does not have money.  He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD for his son’s operation.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his son's operation.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 53 years old and married, with five children.

Leonora is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonora has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking and enterprising woman who practices farming. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for boosting her business.
