He is going to repair his house because it is in a bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc for repairing his house. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en: Gulshan is 28 years old. She is divorced and lives with her parents. Gulshan is going to organize her own sewing business. She had no opportunity or money, but she came to IMON with this plan and here she found support. She studied the women's organization course ‘To Get Ahead’ and got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy fabric and a sewing machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine for organizing a new business

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is married and has six children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal. She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to get more capital in order to expand her business from a retail to a wholesale business. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sadinisso

texts.en:
Born in 1959, Sadinisso was widowed early in her married life and has raised her four children alone. She has been engaged in an animal husbandry business for more than 15 years. She owns land by her house where she grows corn for her cattle, and she earns an income by selling milk and kefir to members of her local community. 

At the present time, Sadinisso's son is about to get married, and Sadinisso does not have enough money to organize the wedding party. She is therefore asking for a loan in the amount of 7,500 Somoni, which she will use to prepare a wedding party for her son and future daughter-in-law. 

She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to organize her son's wedding party

loans.name: Rayhona

texts.en:
Rayhona is a hard-working woman. She is married and does not have any children. 

She has had her own business for more than six years. Rayhona buys fruits and vegetables from one region and sells them in another region. Her husband helps her with managing the business. 

Step-by-step, Rayhona has developed her business. She wants to buy a mini-bus for transporting goods and, in this way, to make faster the cycle of buying and selling. She is asking for a loan of USD 1,500 to buy a mini-bus. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a mini-bus for her business.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn, 32 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a tailoring business for almost 13 years. 

Due to financial constraints, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase an additional electric sewing machine. 

She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can expand her business to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase an additional electric sewing machine.

location.town: Dalupang St. District 2, Cauayan City, Isabela

loans.name: Asilbek

texts.en: Asilbek is 25 years old and lives with his newly wedded wife Damesh in his parents house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife Damesh is currently unemployed and stays home. The new couple is expecting their first baby this year and Asilbek started building a small house for his family. Asilbek has graduated from college and his father bought him a small car and he started providing taxi service business in town. He started saving to build his own small house and now needs additional investment of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation and construction materials to finish building his house for his family. He is a hardworking, modest man who is really excited about becoming a father.

loans.use: to purchase insulation and construction materials to finish building his house for his family

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, a married mother of four children, three of whom go to school, lives in a rented house where the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

Maria has operated a food stall at the market for the last five years, and she works six days a week. Her major business challenges are seasonality and fluctuating prices. 

Maria has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a box of tomatoes, onions, oranges, sweet potatoes and passion fruits. Her goals are to get more capital for expansion and also to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions, oranges, sweet potatoes and passion fruits.

loans.name: Ariun-Enh

texts.en:
Ariun-Enh is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (traditional nomadic yurt house) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His wife Monhzul knits and tailors clothes and small accessories cases which are beautifully embroidered by hand. His two children study at local schools. 

Ariun-Enh used to work at a big silver and gold jewelry manufacturing company for years since 2002. He started his own business in a rental workplace in the local market in 2008. He has built his reputation by providing the best service with qualified products to local clients. He has improved his skills over the years and now crafts a variety of products with custom-made designs. 

He is now requesting loan of 3,150,000 MNT to purchase silver and gold to meet customers' orders on time. This time of the year is the high season for him because the Lunar New Year is coming and he receives more orders now than at any other time.

loans.use: to purchase silver and gold to meet customers' orders on time

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines (makes tires more durable), and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Emma is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing shop.

Emma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her vulcanizing.

loans.name: Gbessay

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Gbessay.  He is married and has two children, aged one and six. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to help the wife's younger sister with her education. In 2010, Gbessay established his photocopying, printing, stationary and drinks business. He began his business to add to his income as lecturer of a tertiary institution. His business is located in the outskirt and his main customers are adults.

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,420,400 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Gbessay has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy stationary. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and expand the business. In the future, Gbessay plans to improve the business and expand to sale on recharge cards. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for stationary

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
This is forty-seven year-old Mahmoud.  He is married and has three children aged five, twenty and twenty-one. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to help in the business. In 1992, Mahmoud established his suitcases, school bags, briefcases and travelling boxes business. He began his business to be self-reliant after coming from the mines. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults.

Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,804,200 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mahmoud has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional travelling boxes. He hopes that this loan can increase the stock and expand the business. In the future, Mahmoud plans to improve the business and expand to the outskirt of town. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy travelling boxes.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is a widow and solely provides the family needs. She earns well from her general store where she has been selling assorted groceries for more than five years. She took a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She always maintains good relations with her clients and wants to improve her business to have a better source of income for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a 41-year-old married father of 3 children, ages 9, 14, and 16 years old. He is from Thika and practices dairy farming with his wife, Jane. Josephat has been in the farming business for the past four years. He earns a monthly income of KES 21,500, which he uses to support his family.

This marks his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya, after successfully repaying his previous loans. He will use the loan to buy another dairy cow and animal feed for his cows. The additional income created will allow him to improve the standard of living for his family and to reinvest the remaining amount in his business.

In the future, Josephat would like to buy more dairy cows. He hopes to save money to educate his children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Jeddida

texts.en:
Jeddida, a 40-year-old single mother of three from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a small retail shop. She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to lack of investment capital. She has been operating the shop for the last eight years. 

This marks her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her store in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

Jeddida is requesting for a loan from VisionFund Kenya in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will be able to improve the living conditions for her family and support the education of her three children. In the future, Jeddida plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a larger wholesale store.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Benadette

texts.en:
Benadette, a 36-year-old married mother of six from Thika, has a business as a mixed-crop farmer. She has been in the farming business for the past ten years. She earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya after clearing her previous loans successfully. She hopes to be able to purchase two dairy cows and pay school fees for her children. Additional income created will be ploughed back into the business and into buying food for the family. 

In the future, Benadette would like to offer her children quality education and to improve the living standards of the whole family. She hopes to expand her dairy farming.

loans.use: to purchase two dairy cows and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma, 33, a resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines. She is married to Jovienes, a construction worker. They have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vilma operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also has a direct sales business and sells frozen foods for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,100 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to help her continue operating her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also use the loan to buy merchandise products for her direct sales business.

Vilma dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Silvana Lourdes

texts.es:
Silvana tiene 36 años de edad estado civil unión libre, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.
Es integrante de ventanilla 30 de Noviembre que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto mina de piedra, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Silvana se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas.  Solicita el préstamo para  poder comprar los fertilizantes para la siembra para arrendar  terrenos además alimento para los animales como balanceados.  Las compras lo realiza en el cantón ventanas.   Su sueño es mejorar su cultivo y la producción para tener una mejor calidad de  vida. El desafío  que enfrenta es combatir contra la naturaleza.  En su tiempo libre le gusta tejer ropa de lana y pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
Silvana is 36 years old and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her husband and her two children in the canton of Ventanas, which is in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member fo the "30 de Noviembre" communal bank, which is located in the rural community of Mina de Piedra, which is also in Ventanas canton. She earns her living in farming and livestock production. 

Silvana grows corn and raises chickens. She is requesting this loan so that she can lease land, buy fertilizers for her crop, and buy pelleted feed for the animals. She makes her purchases in Ventanas canton.

Her dream is to improve her crops and her yield in order to have a better quality of life. The challenge that she faces is battling against nature. In her free time, she likes to knit wool clothing and spend time with her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides and pelleted animal feed.

loans.name: Nay's Group

texts.en:
Nay is 27 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. All of her children are still in school. Nay and her husband are farmers who grow cassava. Having been in this business for nine years, together they earn about 25,000 KHR per day, of which they can save about 12,000 KHR after paying daily expenses. 

Nay’s group consists of two members who are in their second cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Nay has completely repaid her previous loan, which helped her improve her family’s living conditions. As group leader, Nay will use her portion of this loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her cassava and to pay labor fees. She hopes to grow her business and to make more crops to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her cassava

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok, age 60, is married and blessed with five children. Nowadays, her two remaining children still count on her since they are in school. 

For the sake of her entire household, she does crop husbandry, rice farming on a three-hectares area, as well as animal husbandry, chicken, and cow-raising. This business has generated for her almost USD 7 per day. 

This is not the first loan for Sok with VisonFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to support her crop business with a decent income to maintain her living conditions. 

Now, Sok is seeking an education loan to cover the tuition fees for her daughter. She hopes that her daughter can pursue her bachelor degree, specializing in accounting.

loans.use: to cover the tuition fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is from Tsaghkaber village where she lives with her son. For over 25 years, Evelina has been running a farm. Specifically, her farm includes cows, sheep, pigs, and chickens as well as arable land where she cultivates wheat, potatoes and cabbage. Her son helps Evelina to sell the gathered harvest in the local open markets and earn an income for their living. As the only source of income, agriculture helps this family to cover their daily needs and sustain their living. Now, Evelina asks for this loan to purchase seeds, eight sheep and forage for feeding the livestock. This will help her to enlarge her farm and agribusiness. 

Evelina has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her hard work during recent times, Evelina was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.
 
The loan is a hope for this family to overcome financial difficulties and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, sheep and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en:
Khachik is from Gogaran Village of the Lori region. He is a farmer with 30 years of experience. He keeps livestock (cows, sheep, pigs, chickens) and cultivates potato, wheat, and grass. As the only breadwinner of the family, Khachik feels very responsible for earning a good income to cover his family's basic needs. Khachik has requested this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Khachik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

The loan will be a huge support for this farmer and his family, and they hope for your support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 35 years old. She is married with five children and they are all enrolled in school. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and beans to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and beans to resell.

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en: Marcel is 31 years old. He is a father of two, and his wife works as a farmer. He sells animals such as goats and cattle. He has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, he would like to provide food for the family.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cattle for resale.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Kwekwe, Zimbabwe. Beauty volunteers in schools as a Cama community health trainer spreading health information to school children and her community members. She is currently running a market gardening business which she started in April. One of her goals as a health trainer is to help people eat healthy foods and live healthy lives as well. The business has also allowed her to pay for school fees for two of her children and provide food for her family. She sells various types of vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, spinach, cassava, sweet potatoes, and carrots in her community. 

Beauty sees a good opportunity to grow her business since there are no fruit and vegetable shops in her area.  Beauty would like to use the loan to open her own vegetable shop and meet the needs of her community, and she also hopes to hire employees. This Kiva loan will give her a chance to take her enterprise to the next level.

loans.use: To cover the costs of opening a fruit and vegetable shop

loans.name: Kireku Development Group

texts.en:
Mable is a widow with four children, who lost her husband early in 2002, leaving her with the responsibility of caring for the young family, She is a hardworking lady who currently runs a lady’s salon from which she earns money for her household living.

She intends to expand it to a higher level and possibly shift to a bigger place where she can access many customers. However her biggest problem is limited capital which also limits her profits. She thanks the group members for standing by her in times of financial crisis.

loans.use: To buy hair products and cosmetics to sell in the beauty shop

loans.name: Tarieli

texts.en:
Tarieli, age 58, cultivates potatoes and maize on a plot of farmland to earn an income. He generates a small income by selling his produce to local traders. 

Tarieli lives in the Kvareli district. His wife lives abroad and his sons live in a different town.

In order to more effectively meet his daily costs, as well as to be in a position to offer more help to his sons, Tarieli has requested a loan. He received the credit within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo called "Start-up Program," which gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With his loan funds of 700 Gel, Tarieli will start a new clothing sales business. He will purchase clothing items at wholesale prices and sell them door-to-door in his community. His customers will be his co-workers, neighbors, and community members. Tarieli plans to sell a wide assortment of reasonably-priced clothing for men, women, and children. 

Though Tarieli expects this work to be hard at first, he is ready to deal with the initial difficulties and develop his trading business gradually. 

Tarieli relies on the goodwill of his lenders and highly appreciates their support.

loans.use: to purchasea  stock of clothing so that he can start trading

loans.name: Tabitha  Wanjiru

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married mother of 3 and lives is Muranga County, central Kenya. Two of her children have completed high school while one is still in school. The two could not proceed to college due to financial constraints and now they have joined their mother in the farming business. The family depends on the 3 acre piece of land for agriculture and dairy farming to get income for their basic needs. They grow vegetables and cereal for their food, and fodder for their 5 cows.

After a training in their group about Biogas by VEP officials, Tabitha approached VEP to have a Biodigester constructed for her. All she would need is money and the expertise offered by VEP and many of her problems especially fuel problems would be solved. She now appreciates that money spent buying charcoal and kerosine can be saved, by using biogas for cooking and lighting. She will also practice organic farming by using bio-slurry which will lead to higher yield. This way she can have enough food for the family and probably sell some. With the savings and a little income she hopes her daughters can enroll in a college for a diploma course and this will give them a better future. For sure biogas will improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester

loans.name: Anita Guillermina

texts.es: Anita Guillermina, mayor de edad casada  originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsables con ganas de superación personal, Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo terminar sus estudios, debido a que tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar,anteriormente se dedicaba a la compra venta de chatarra pero con el nuevo financiamiento decide poner una pulperia en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, salsa de tomate,aceite, arroz, frijoles, jugos, pan, huevos, sal, azúcar, leche, productos congelados, entre otros su jornada diaria empieza desde muy temprano al abrir su pulperia para atender a sus clientes . El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, detergentes, golosinas, papel higiénicos, productos congelados entre otros mas. Anita Guillermina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Anita Guillermina is originally from the municipality of Chinandega in the west of Nicaragaua.  She is a hard-working and responsible woman with a desire to get ahead.  Unfortunately, for financial reasons, Anita was unable to finish her education as she had to help with the household costs.  Previously Anita worked selling scrap metal but, with a new loan, she has decided to start a grocery store in her home where she will sell small quantities of household goods such as sachets of coffee and shampoo, tomato sauce, oil, rice, beans, juices, bread, eggs, salt, sugar, milk, frozen products and more.  Anita's day starts very early when she opens her grocery store to tend to her customers.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital and stock up her business with consumable goods such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, detergents, sweets, toilet paper, frozen goods, and more. Anita is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide to poor people in order for them to have a decent job and to poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy consumable goods such as rice, sugar, beans, frozen good, sweets, detergents, and more.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima earns an income by operating a restaurant business at the market. She has been engaged in her business for the past five years and works six days a week. She reports that her major challenges are transportation and fluctuating prices.

Halima is the sole breadwinner supporting her four children. The family lives in a house that has access to piped water and electricity. All four children attend school. Halima's primary monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Halima has requested a loan in the amount of 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO in order to buy cooking oil, flour, tomatoes, rice, green bananas, and sweet potatoes. 

Her goal for her business is eventually to buy a refrigerator so that she can start selling cold drinks.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, tomatoes, rice, green bananas, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. Nodira has a higher pedagogical education. She works in a school as a teacher of history. Nodira’s husband is a master of repairing houses. 

They have a small income and that’s why they have not had an opportunity to repair their house. Nodira is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy building materials as cement and wood for repairing house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials as cement and wood for repairing her house

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza was born in 1984 year at a village which is located in the south part of Tajikistan. She is not married. She used to meet her family's needs using her income from growing carrots and potatoes. 

She has been busy with this business more than ten years. She tries to develop the business and to attain more clients.  She has enough skill for her business. She wants to make a new sowing of vegetables and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 1500 USD: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, and fuel, and to pay for rental workers.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, and fuel,  and to pay for rental workers

loans.name: Kulusum

texts.en: Kulusum  is married with five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for three years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  She generates additional income from selling spare parts.  She works six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to start going to villages to purchase her green bananas. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water.  Her monthly expenses  include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Apeihan

texts.en:
Apeihan is 45 years old lives with his wife and three children in a small house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife Gulnazi works at a local company. His older two children attend local schools and the youngest son is in kindergarten. 

Apeihan has been providing an inter-province transportation service for years. He is a careful and reliable driver who is already well-known in the province. He needs to be more settled to teach or help his children with their homework and other school work.

He has decided to replace his mini-bus with a smaller but more convenient car to start providing a taxi service business within the town. He is now requesting loan of 3,000,00 MNT to purchase a better secondhand  car to start providing taxi in the province center. He is a hardworking, responsible and thoughtful man.

loans.use: to purchase a better second hand  car to start providing taxi in the province center

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en:
Lhamsuren is 47 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in small house in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband runs a small organic vegetable growing and sales business. Her two older children are university students and the youngest child is enrolling in university next fall.
 
Lhamsuren and her husband run a small vegetable growing and sales business for a living. They have lot of experience and regular customers. The organic vegetables they grow are full of vitamins and fresh, and their customers have a really pleasant experience with their service as well.
 
Lhamsuren is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to insulate her house and change old wooden windows into vacuum windows in order to reduce heat loss, and renovate the wooden fence around the plot of land.

loans.use: to insulate her house and change old wooden windows into vacuum windows in order to reduce heat loss and renovate the wooden fence around the plot of land

loans.name: Pilar Olenka

texts.es:
La socia Pilar olenka se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cerveza al por mayor y tambien la socia trabaja en una empresa como cajera,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de cerveza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cerveza al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Pilar Olenka continues to sell beer in quantity.  She also works as a cashier for another company.  She has had her beer business for several years and her dream is to grow it.  She is asking for a loan to buy beer in quantity.  She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy beer.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is a 42-year-old mother who was gifted with five children. Her family currently resides in a rural community. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Annabelle helps her husband in generating income through a buy-and-sell business of fruits, vegetables and grocery items. 

She aims to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers’ demands, but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is requesting additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of fruits, vegetables and grocery items to sell. 

Through patience and hard work, she believes that she will make her business viable and profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits, vegetables and grocery items to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a single, 23-year-old businessman in Thika. John operates a motorcycle transport business. He also operates a quarry and does mixed crop farming, businesses that supplement his monthly income. 

He has operated the motorcycle transport business for the past three years. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000, which he uses to support himself and his mother. 

This marks his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya after repaying his previous loan successfully. With this loan, he will be able to purchase a new motorcycle. The additional income created will allow him to purchase quarrying equipment. 

In the future, John would like to get married and have children. His hopes are to buy a public service vehicle and become an established businessman.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
This is Ivy, 38, resident of Caloocan 5, Philippines, and a mother to her children. Her partner is Romeo, a mason. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Ivy operates a food stall. She sells barbecue, cooked eggs, mangoes, and other snacks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like pork, chicken, eggs, mangoes, and other ingredients. 

Ivy hopes to grow her business in the coming years. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantities of products like pork, chicken, eggs, mangoes, and other ingredients

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. She sells sodas and beers, and has been doing so for two years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sodas and beers for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more sodas and beers for sale

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 18 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos viv con los padres en casa de ellos,vive en en el Canton Mocache Perteneciente a la Provicncia de los Rios.

La ventanilla se llama 27 DE OCTUBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Sara Guerrero, perteneciente al Canton Mocache se dedican a labores Agricolas y Pecuarias.

Jessica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz  y a la crianza de pollos. Las compras las realiza en Mocache en la feria de los dias Jueves.

Con el dinero ha podido cubrir algunas necesidades como el pago de la mano de obra y adquir algunos insumos.El credito solicito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos semillas y una bomba para fumigar. 

La meta es ahorrar dinero para cuando se case pueda comprar un terreno y construir la casa para la familia. Cuando tiene tiempo libre le gusta ver la televion de preferencia un programa que se llama calle 7.
texts.en:
Jessica is 18 years old and is single with no children. She lives with her parents at home in Mocache county in the Los Rios province. 

The community bank is named "27 DE OCTUBRE," which is located in the Sara Guerrero community in Mocache county, and the members work in agriculture and with livestock. 

Jessica works in agriculture. She plants corn and raises chickens. Jessica will make her purchases in the Mocache market, which takes place on Thursdays.

With the loan she has been able to cover various needs, such as paying the hired help, and purchasing various supplies. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, and a spray pump. 

Her goal is to save money for when she gets married so that she can buy land and build a home for her family. When she has free time, Jessica likes to watch TV and likes a program called "Calle 7."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, and a spray pump.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar is 27 years old, married and the father of two children. He earns most of his income by poultry farming but also grows coffee and sells medications. He began his poultry business because he needed more income to meet his increased family needs. He will use this loan to expand his poultry business by buying more chicks as well as feed. He hopes in the future to be able to buy machines that can ease his work. His main challenges are using so much labor because he lacks equipment, and the high cost of feed. He is hard working. In the photograph we see the client with a UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Soemleng's Group

texts.en:
Soemleng is 43 years old and a local villager from Prey Chhor district of Kompong Cham province. She is blessed with one son and one daughter. Both of them are studying in school and they are under her responsibility. To deal with the family’s needs, she and her husband plant paddy rice and grow vegetables such as cucumber and bean as the main source of income; it is the business that she has had for 15 years. 

Soemleng, the fourth-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), has repaid back her past three loans with success and it has helped her to earn a decent income to buy household appliances and to keep her kids in school. For this cycle, she leads a group of two to get a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer to support her business. She hopes that she can grow her rice on time so that she can double her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to support her business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine is from Katnaghbyur village of Aragatsotn region. She lives with her husband and son and together with them has been involved in agriculture for more than 25 years. They keep a livestock of cows, chickens, pigs and calves and also cultivate potatoes and grass. Hermine uses the milk to produce cheese and sells it locally. The income from agriculture is important for this family so they would like to improve and increase it. By asking for this loan Hermine would like to purchase 4 cows which will help her to gather more milk and increase cheese production. 

Hermine has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay.  However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Hermine was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan will greatly help Hermine and her family and she will be very grateful for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase four cows

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 38 years old and lives in West Point. She’s married and is a mother of two children. Her husband is a schoolteacher, and all of their children are attending school.

Alice, who has beem selling drinks in her community for a livelihood for the past years, enjoys her business. According to her, she makes a lot of profit and it enables her to send her children to school.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase more drinks (soda, beer, etc.). She plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks (soda, beer, etc.).

loans.name: Olsa

texts.en:
This will be Olsa's son's last year of college and the tuition fees are 100,000 Albanian Lek so she needs your help again. 

Thanks to you all he finished the previous year and mother and son are very appreciative of the financial help they received from all lenders.

loans.use: To pay her son's last college tuition fees.

loans.name: Jay Jatia Budha Shg Group

texts.en:
"Jay Jatia Budha SHG" Self-Help Group consists of eleven women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves and share their problems, and to solve their problems among them. All the members of this group are engaged in different business activities like vegetable cultivation, flower plant-selling, fish-selling, etc., so that they can make money to better help and support their families. 

One of them is Anjubala, who was selected as their president of Jay Jatia Budha SHG Self-Help Group. The lady standing with a raised hand in the photo is Anjubala. Anjubala is 35 years old and is staying with her husband and her two children, aged four years and seven years, who are in school. She hopes to see her children as officers in a company or in a government job. 

She has a three-acre plot of land in her village, and she is utilizing her land in sugarcane cultivation. Her husband is supporting her in this activity.
 
Anjubala has requested a loan of 165,000 INR for her group. She will use her portion to purchase the required resources for sugarcane cultivation. She says a portion of the loan amount will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase required resources like sugarcane plants, fertilizers and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses for sugarcane cultivation.

loans.name: Jose Esteban

texts.es:
José Esteban de 27 años de edad, casados con dos hijos menores de edad. Es originario de la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser un padre responsables, trabajador, con ganas de salir adelante, en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia.  El en la actualidad lucha mucha ya que es el único que trabaja de vela por el bienestar de su familia.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la crianza de cerdos en pie para la venta  El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación.  El dedica a su actividad una 8 horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabaja y surtir su negocio en la compra de un lote de cerdos para la crianza y ventas para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. José Esteban agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas  kiva le brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Jose Esteban is 27 years old, and is married with two young children.  He comes from the northern part of the country.  He is a responsible and hard-working father with a desire to get ahead.  In his free time he enjoys the company of his family.  He is currently struggling greatly because he is the only one working for the welfare of his family.  Due to his efforts and his desire to get ahead he works raising pigs to sell.  His business is located in his home.  He works at this business 8 hours a day, and enjoys his work very much.  The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital, and to supply his business  by buying a lot to raise and sell the pigs, so as to have more income in the near future.  Jose Esteban is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people of modest resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they will be able to work with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to supply his business of buying and selling pigs.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is a married mother with four children, three of whom are employed as garment workers to help the family with financial needs. As a local market vendor, Chantha sells a variety of fish from a rented booth, earning a net income of USD 8.00 per day. She usually spends her profits on meals, home bills and other commodities. Chantha has been in this occupation for almost 10 years. 

Due to a lack of capital in her business, Chantha would like to obtain a loan of USD 500 to purchase fish to sell in her store. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and she will gain more income. She expresses her thanks to all lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel is still in college, studying for a bachelor of science in business administration. Her previous loan from GDMPC was used to pay school tuition for the last semester. Recently, Maricel borrowed a new loan to pay the school obligations for the current semester. The poverty that her family has been fighting is not a hindrance for her to continue her dream. In the future, she hopes to get a job in their town and if given a chance to explore outside the country, then she would.

loans.use: to pay school fees for the current semester.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita, 67, and resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children who help her manage their household while operating the business. Age is not a hindrance for her to stop working to continuously provide for her everyday needs.

Lolita operates a rug-making business. She mainly offers rugs, from round palm-sized ones, to the much larger doormats and other crafts that most rug-makers produce every day. As rugs are a major part of Filipino housekeeping and cleaning, rugs are one of the most common products that can be bought, sometimes even from a peddler while you are riding in a speeding jeepney down the highway. She also sells mineral water for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP16,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business. 

Lolita dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her family will always have a good relationship. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Lilia Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Lilia Elizabeth, 49, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She has children and they help her manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilia Elizabeth operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for each item in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lilia Elizabeth earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Lilia Elizabeth is requesting a PHP 40,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lilia Elizabeth dreams that her business will be stable and hopes to give her children a good future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jenaline

texts.en:
Jenaline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell feed business in the Philippines. She has had this business for five years.

Jenaline requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

In the future, Jenaline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell

loans.name: Malakhat

texts.en:
Malakhat is 53 years old, married with one child. She is Azerbaijanian, and has lived in Georgia for years. Malakhat sows greens on her own piece of land and sells her production at the capital city open market. 

Her earnings are modest and in order to generate more income, Malakhat plans to buy fruit and vegetables and sell the production from her stall. With the received amount, she will pay for these products and enlarge her trading business.

The family will be able to get a good profit and increase the turnover gradually.

Malakhat awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables in bulk to sell

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en:
Navy is 51 years old, widowed, and has five children. She grows rice as the main source of income, which she has been doing for 30 years. To earn additional income, Navy works for others for a fee. She currently earns about 34,000 KHR per day. 

Navy is requesting her second loan from VisionFund for 1,000,000 KHR, which she will use to buy fertilizer and rice seed for the upcoming replanting season. Her joint borrower is requesting his seventh loan from VisionFund also for 1,000,000 KHR. Kay's prior loan enabled her to improve her living condition in a gradual manner. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as she can renovate her kitchen and build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Sokhuon's Group

texts.en: A young mother of two dependent daughters, residing in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Sokhuon is the breadwinner of the family who strives for a living via a sweet-selling and maize-trading business. She has engaged in this business for several years. This is not a first time loan for Sokhuon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan completely, and it has enabled her to support her business promptly as well as to sustain her living condition progressively. Now, in a group of two seeking 1,400,000 KHR each, she is the group representative. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy sweets for resale, and to use some portion of her loan to buy more maize to resell. She hopes that she can purchase more corn on time to stock and resell it for a high price so that she can make double income from this business.

loans.use: to buy sweets for resale, and to use some portion of her loan to buy more maize to resell.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom, a mother of four kids and a widow, is a villager from Battambang province’s Thmorl Koul district. She struggles for the daily cost of living through six hectares of rice cropping as a single source of income. Having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Sokhom has utilized her previous loans in a smart way to support her business promptly as well as cover the basic needs in her household. Now, she teams up as a group of two to get a new loan. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy good seed and fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that this purchase will enable her to boost her crop yield timely with a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy good seed and fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Sony's Group

texts.en:
Sony, aged 32, is from Battambang province. She is a local rice grower who earns about 35,500 KHR per day to ensure the daily food consumption of her family, which consists of three schoolchildren. 

This is Sony's first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. Sony highly hopes that she can support her agribusiness promptly with a good income in return.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach, aged 40, is a villager originally from the Mourng Russey district of Battambang province. She is a local farmer who has been growing rice and pineapple on one hectare of land for 10 years. Her family also earns additional income in their spare time by working for others for a fee. 

Mach is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she joins a group of two taking out a loan of 500,000 KHR each. As group leader, Mach will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her pineapple crop. She believes that she will get a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her pineapple crop.

loans.name: Phanny's Group

texts.en:
Phanny, 21 years old, is married and has one young daughter. Phanny lives in a wooden house in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province. The family's main source of income is from planting corn and her husband works as a garment worker. Together, they earn about 27,000 KHR per day. 

This is the first loan for Phanny’s group of two members. As group leader, Phanny is going to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and to sell it for a good price so as to make a better living and send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a wife to a pastor of a local church. Every Sunday after mass she invites visitors to their home for lunch. Her visitors eat before leaving for their homes and Sarah spends most of the early morning every Sunday in the kitchen lighting up the fireplace in order to prepare food for her visitors. Sarah's fears are in the amount of firewood she uses to prepare food for her visitors, as wood and charcoal fuels have become very expensive because they are scarce. 

Sarah was the first from her church to register for a Kiva loan to buy a cooking gas package from WANA. Sarah says that she will no longer waste time in the kitchen preparing food for her visitor; rather, she will be spending most of Sundays talking to her visitors. Sarah is happy that at last they have accessed gas, which will enable her to reduce the cost of fuel used for cooking for her visitors and also help preserve the trees.

loans.use: to pay for LPG cooking appliance in order to reduce the amount of firewood used for home cooking

loans.name: Lida

texts.es: Lida, de 40 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre junto a ella, además de su hermana y una sobrina. El negocio que tiene Lida en la venta de golosinas para eso instaló una pequeña bodega en la casa de su madre donde ofrece a la venta diversas golosinas como caramelos, chocolates, galletas y otros, además vende bebidas gaseosas. Se inició en la venta de golosinas gracias a un pequeño capital económico que pudo juntar por mucho tiempo, desde entonces ha podido multiplicar su inversión y sus ganancias son satisfactorias. Adquiere sus productos realizando compras cada dos días, siendo sus principales clientes sus vecinos y transeúntes. Trabaja con la ayuda de su mamá o de su hermana quienes se encargan de la atención cuando ella esta fuera de casa. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder tener un ingreso económico que le ayuden a solventar sus gastos personales y con los que puede apoyar en los gastos del hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1000, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. El  monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas al por mayor como chocolates, caramelos, galletas y chizitos.
texts.en:
Lida is 40, single, and does not have any children. She lives in her mother's house with her mother, a sister and a niece. Lida has a business selling snacks, and for this she has installed a small store-room in her mother's house where she sells various snacks such as sweets, chocolates and biscuits, as well as soft drinks. She started off selling snacks thanks to a small amount of capital that she was able to get together over a long time. Since then she has been able to grow her investment, and her profits are satisfactory. She gets hold of her goods by buying every two days. Her main customers are her neighbours and passers-by. She works with the help of her mother or her sister, who look after things when she is out of the house. What she enjoys about her work is being able to have an income that helps her to buy things for herself and to contribute to the household bills.

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 PEN and is grateful to the people who facilitate the finance she needs so that she can make her plans come true. In addition, she promises to meet the loan repayments punctually. She will invest the loan in buying wholesale snacks such as chocolates, sweets, biscuits and puffed corn.

loans.use: to buy wholesale snacks.

loans.name: Mhandu Group

texts.en:
A married woman in her early 30s, Stella has two daughters, both of whom attend school. She has been running a shop selling clothes and shoes for four years now. Open from 9 am to 6 pm daily, she is able to earn a good monthly profit. 

This will be Stella's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Her previous loan, since repaid, was used to buy new clothes and shoes for her business to resell. Stella used her profit to pay school fees and home food expenses, and saved the remainder. She will use this loan to buy business clothes to meet customer demand. She dreams of being an international business person. 

Stella will share this loan with her loan group "MHANDU", which consists of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy business clothes to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Ama did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming a petty trader. Currently, Ama sells charcoal at Abura, located in the Central Region. She has been in business for about one year. She is married to a farmer and has four children.  She uses all her income to support her husband to feed and provide for the entire family.  Ama will use the loan to purchase  bags of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: purchase  bags of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Kyrey Guarambare Group

texts.es:
El comité inicia el 6to. ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo por poder aprender y por medio de eso ayudar a sus familias. Son mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras.
María, una de las miembros, comenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de todo tipo, y gracias a los ingresos que tiene por medio de este trabajo, ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan y que no les falte nada.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras para seguir con sus ventas y seguir luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: This committee is starting its 6th loan cycle, with a committee of women who are putting forth their best efforts to be able to learn and thereby help their families.  They are hardworking women who are fighters. Maria is one of the members, and works selling all kinds of fruit and vegetables.  With the income that she earns from this work she helps her family, and provides for them so that they lack for nothing. She is requesting this loan to invest in buying fruit and vegetables, so as to continue with her sales and continue fighting to improve her life and the lives of her family members.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a conservative person who prefer not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Samah is a 21-year-old married woman from a small village near Qalqilia City. She lives with her husband in a small simple house in the city. Samah's husband is a worker with a non stable wage. Four years ago, Samah started her own project which is raising sheep to help her husband with part of the family expenses. She would like to improve her business and increase the number of sheep in her farm.
 
Samah took a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to develop her farm by adding more sheep. By taking this loan, Samah will be able to increase her productivity and also her income.

loans.use: to purchase additional sheep to develop her farm

loans.name: Jowe

texts.en: Jowe is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.  She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from frying edibles and selling charcoal.  She moves door-to-door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and seasonality. She is aspiring to get a permanent business activity and to get enough profit to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is a 35-year-old single man from a small village near Jenin City. He lives in a small simple house with his family. Basem works as an employee in the public sector with a low income. This income barely covers his needs. Basem has a problem in the bones in his leg. He needs to do an urgent surgery but he does not have enough money.

Basem took a 800 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the hospital expenses for doing a surgery for his leg. By taking this loan, Basem will be able get back to work and do his daily activities.
 
Basem appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses for a necessary leg surgery

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has operated a business selling fruits and vegetables in her village for almost ten years. She also has a stall along the national highway where vehicles and passengers pass by. 

Mary Jane spent her profits on school allowances for her two children. Due to financial constraints she wants to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell. She will manage her business well as her stepping stone to becoming a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Kathleen

texts.en: Kathleen is studying business administration to earn a Bachelor of Science degree. Kathleen’s family runs a business buying and selling coconuts to make a living. She has three siblings and providing for school fees and education is not easy. She used her previous loan from GDMPC to buy school materials, books, and other items to be used for the last semester. Recently, she borrowed another loan to cover the costs for her allowances and other miscellaneous expenses needed. In the future, she dreams of finishing her studies and becoming successful.

loans.use: to cover the costs for her allowances and other miscellaneous expenses needed

loans.name: Decita

texts.en: Decita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She sells clothes and other fashion accessories to the people in her area. Decita is requesting a loan to buy more stock of shirts, pants, fashion accessories, etc. This will enable Decita to cater to more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, she hopes to make her business a sustainable success.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shirts, pants, fashion accessories, etc.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 41 and chose to be single. She lives with her mother in a rural community and is managing a small sari-sari store. She aims to make her business profitable in order to satisfy their daily consumption and save some for her future. 

Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of soft drinks, snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soaps, beverages, noodles, canned goods and seasonings to sell in her store. 

She believes that someday she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, snack foods, assorted candies, laundry soaps, beverages, noodles, canned goods and seasonings to sell.

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg lives in Sisian town with his mother. He is a young farmer. The farm that he runs includes 15 sheep, 5 cows and 2 calves. In addition to farming, Gevorg works at one of the local companies as a toiler.
 
He does his best to gather a good income and cover his small family's basic costs. In order to be able to enlarge his farm, Gevorg has applied for this loan. He plans to purchase 10 sheep and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Gevorg's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

The loan will be a huge support for this hard working, young farmer to expand his farm and provide his mother with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 10 sheep and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is from Kapan. He has been involved in beekeeping for the last three years, and produces high-quality honey which is in high demand among people who live nearby. Ara lives with his wife and two little children. His wife is a teacher at a local school and also takes care of their children. Agriculture is the family's main source of income. Ara has applied for this loan to be build bee hives and hire workers. The loan will help him enlarge his production of honey and earn more income.

Ara has already taken out a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it on time. However, thanks to his hard work in recent times, he was able to operate his beekeeping business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the new monthly payments. So, Ara has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and no access to credit products. The loan is very important if Ara is to enlarge his business and provide a better life to his family.

loans.use: to make bee hives and hire workers.

loans.name: Khoren

texts.en:
Khoren is from Eghegnadzor town where he lives with his wife and 25-years-old son. 

Khoren has been involved in beekeeping for 20 years. He owns 30 colonies of bees, gets high quality honey and sells it locally. As honey is a must have item for almost each household of Eghegnadzor town and the whole region, Khoren has a good number of buyers. 

Because of a hard financial situation Khoren is unable to invest in his beekeeping business and enlarge it. Therefore, he has applied for this loan. It will enable him to purchase 16 beehives and 13 colonies of bees, and also he will pay for a polyethylene cover for a greenhouse. This is very important for Khoren to enlarge his business and increase the income for his family.

Khoren has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back on time. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Khoren was able to run his honey selling business in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, Khoren has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene cover for a greenhouse, 16 beehives, and 13 colonies of bees

loans.name: Hour's Group

texts.en: A local citizen from Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Hour is a 53 year-old mother of six children. Currently only one child is under her responsibility. To support her family, Hour does rice cropping as the main source of her family’s income. She has engaged in this current business for ages and it has returned her about 27,000 KHR per day.This is the second loan cycle for Hour with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The first loan, that she has repaid back completely, has enabled her to improve her business and provide her with more stable living conditions than before. Now, she forms a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay reaping fees. She hopes to gain a good yield with a high income.

loans.use: to pay rice reaping fees for her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Safiatu

texts.en:
Safiatu is 65 years old, married, and has six children, one of whom attends school. She lives in West Point. Her husband is a contractor at a construction firm. For the past 11 years, Safiatu has been selling oil in the local market. During the raining season her sales are low but she still makes profit.

Safiatu is  requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase 30 gallons of oil for her business.  She plans to send her children to the university and build a house for them in the future.

loans.use: to purchase 30 gallons of oil for her business

loans.name: Lancy

texts.en:
Lancy is 27 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. She lives in West Point. For the past four years, Lancy has been selling slippers and shoes. During the raining season her sales are very low.

Lancy is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more shoes and slippers for her business. She plans to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and slippers

loans.name: Suryia

texts.en: Suryia is a 50-year-old married lady and is running a small general store in her community.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her shop.  She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her shop fully stocked she requested a loan for 55,000 PKR which she will use to buy stock of grains, biscuits, and beverages from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Suryia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of grains, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 53-year-old married woman. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become popular for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business, and currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Manzoran

texts.en:
Manzoran is a 58-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling animals for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up,  and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation; currently she requested a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina, age 45, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Joanne

texts.en:
Joanne is 33 years old and has three children. Joanne is married and has one child who is still in school.

Joanne is in the agricultural business; pig fattening in the Philippines. Joanne requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

Joanne has been in the pig fattening business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Joanne would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. She is married and raises ducks in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years now.

Lilia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her ducks.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her ducks

loans.name: Judeven

texts.en:
Judeven, 36 years old, is married and has three children, two of them still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past year, Judeven has operated a banana vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell. Judeven would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena works hard to support her family. Ma. Elena is married and has a rug-making business in the Philippines.  Ma. Elena requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.  Ma. Elena has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Vang

texts.en: Vang is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food product to sell. This purchase will help her to attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall, increase sales, and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food to attract more customers

loans.name: Khoen

texts.en:
Khoen lives in a rural village in the Phnom Srouch district of Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She is 53 years old and married with three children. To support her family, Khoen has been working as a rice farmer and sugarcane planter for 35 years. She currently earns about US $5 per day from her current businesses but she can save about US $2.50 each day after expenses.

Khoern is just with VisionFund this cycle. She is applying for an education loan to pay for her son’s university tuition fees. She hopes this loan will enable her son to have a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition fees

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Maram Mandera

texts.en:
Maram is 38 years of age and a mother of four children, three of whom go to school. She heard about Finance South Sudan through marketing posters. She is a businesswoman who operates a shop in Munuki Town, South Sudan. She has been doing this business for close to three years. 
Maram is borrowing a loan worth 3000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable her buy more stock like sugar, flour, cooking oil, salt, rice and many other mixed goods for her shop.
The loan will also help her pay school fees for her children and meet some basic needs for the family.

loans.use: To buy items like cooking oil, beans, sugar, salt, etc.

loans.name: Lona Mamaru

texts.en:
Lona is 35 years of age and a mother of three children who all go to school. She heard about Finance South Sudan through other clients. She is a businesswoman who operates a shop in Munuki Town, South Sudan. She has been doing this business for close to four years. 
Lona is borrowing a loan worth 3000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable her buy more stock like sugar, flour, cooking oil, salt, rice and many other mixed goods for her shop.
The loan will also help her pay school fees for her children and meet some basic needs for the family.

loans.use: To buy items like flour, salt, sugar and rice

loans.name: Manase Lemi

texts.en:
Lemi is 47 year-old, married father of six children. four of whom go to school. He heard about Finance South Sudan through other clients. He is a businessman who owns a shop in Munuki Town, South Sudan. He has been doing this business for four years now.
