Lemi is borrowing a loan worth 4000 South Sudanese Pounds to help him buy more stock like sugar, beans, salt, rice and many other mixed items for his shop.
He says the loan will also help him pay school fees for his children and improve the lives of his family.

loans.use: To buy items like sugar, salt, beans and rice

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh, 38, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one daughter and her husband. Her husband is an embroiderer. Oanh earns money through her business selling sugar-cane juice and rice. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of sugar-cane and rice to serve her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of sugar-cane and rice

loans.name: Clement  Samuel

texts.en:
Clement is 40 years old and a father of five children who all go to school. He heard about Finance South Sudan through other clients. He is a businessman who operates a shop in Munuki Town, South Sudan. He has been doing this business for close to seven years.

Clement is borrowing a loan worth 3,000 SSP to enable him to buy more inventory like sugar, flour, cooking oil, salt, rice and many other mixed goods for his shop. The loan will also help him pay school fees for his children and meet some basic needs for the family.

loans.use: To buy items like sugar, flour, cooking oil, salt, and rice

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 48-year-old widow and a mother of eight children. She has been responsible for the family since her husband passed away. Today she is the sole breadwinner for two members of her family. The rest of the family started their own businesses to make living easier for their mother.

Randa is a hard worker who started a knitting business in her home 25 years ago. She is a very talented and skilled knitter. Twenty-one years ago, she also started a small business in her home, creating souvenirs for weddings, births, and other special events. She also arranges special artificial flowers bouquets.

Randa has been an Al Majmoua borrower for four consecutive cycles. Through her previous loans, Randa was able to buy tools and other items necessary for her business in order to increase the amount of special souvenirs. She also helped to open a grocery store for her son to increase her family's income. There has been a very impressive result on both their social and financial situations. 

Today, she is applying for a new loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her knitted merchandise. She wants to create special released wool colors and designs and to work on developing and increasing her production for the Christmas and winter season. She will also use part of the loan to purchase electric household appliances for her son who is getting ready to get married.

Randa's history is in good standing, and she is working hard to open a small school that teaches the making of handmade souvenirs, embroidering, knitting, and other arts. This is her dream that she hopes to make come true.

loans.use: to increase her knitted merchandise and to purchase appliances.

loans.name: Abdel Hadi

texts.en:
Abdel Hadi is a 20-year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house in the city. Abdel has worked on his own farm for the past three years. He is raising sheep and selling its products in the local market. He would like to improve his business and increase the number of sheep on his farm.
 
Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to develop his farm by adding more sheep. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.

Abdel appears in the photo at his farm.

loans.use: to develop his farm by adding more sheep.

loans.name: Marie Solange

texts.en: Marie Solange is a businesswoman running a hardware business. She is married to a businessman. She has requested the loan to buy more building materials for sale such as iron sheets, cements and painting colors. She plans to use the profits for making more savings.

loans.use: to buy more construction materials such as iron sheets, cements and painting for sale.

loans.name: Amartaivan

texts.en:
Amartaivan is 41 years old and lives with his wife and a son in a small house in Selenge province, Mongolia. His wife, Altanshagai, is currently staying home taking care of their 1 year old son, Amarjargal. 

Amartaivan started his taxi service business in town in 2005. He has been improving his services by replacing his car each year from his business profit. He is well-known with his good and safe service in the province center. He needs to increase his income since they have new baby boy and family expenses have increased. He is a hardworking and thoughtful person who now needs 1,000,000 MNT to replace some spare parts to continue providing his taxi service business without interruption.

loans.use: to replace some spare parts to continue providing his taxi service business without interruption.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Battsetseg is 37 years old and lives with her 2 children in her small house in Selenge province, Mongolia. Her husband passed away 3 years ago and her 2 children study at the local school.

Battsetseg used to cook traditional food and deliver it to local market retailers and small business owners during lunch time and early supper time for a few years. In 2012, she started her own business of a small cafeteria close to the local market where more of a crowd is located. She is well-known with her qualified and tasty food among her clients. She is now requesting loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows to reduce heat loss and stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winter.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and vacuum windows to reduce heat loss and stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winter.

loans.name: Mean's Group

texts.en: Mean, 35, is a mother of four dependent children residing in Dambae district of Battambang province. Nowadays, three of her children are in school. The remaining one is too young for schooling. She tackles cassava farming for a living as the main source of income. Her family can earn additional income as well via a fish catching business and working for others for a fee. This is not the first loan for Mean with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid back her loan with success and it has helped her to improve her living standards. Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. She is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while her co-borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and a water pump and to pay for labor fees. She hopes to gain a good income better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and a pump machine and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a married lady with 2 children hailing from Nkokonjeru kamukuzi a suburb in Mbarara municipality. Unfortunately, her husband is not earning and doesn’t mind about the family and even the children’s school fees. Joan operates a business dealing in clothes and it’s where she earns a living and survival for the whole family. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to boost the business. She will buy new shoes and children's clothes that will lighten up her shop to attract more customers. This will in turn increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy stock of shoes and children's clothes.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley lives in West Point, which has one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 29 years old, single and has three children between 2 and 16 years old. Two of them are in school and all of them live at home. For the past three years, she has been frying and selling plantains, chicken, fish, and cala (dough like) in her community. She got the money to start this business from her oldest sister. She is requesting her fourth loan to purchase more plantains, fish, flour, pepper, etc. for her business. She wishes to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains, fish, flour, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en: Firuz is a 24-year-old married man from Urekhi district. He lives with his wife who works as a nurse and monthly generates 300 GEL. Firuz is a hard working and motivated person with great desire to provide financial stability for his little family. He works as an artisan with private orders and wants somehow to improve his income. Firuz decided to request a loan too open a fast food cafe. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 USD to purchase merchandise such as equipment, supplies and apparatus for preparing special traditional meals. This activity will help Firuz's work to be more productive, save money and arrange a better future for his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies to open a fast food cafe

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 41-year-old married woman.  She is running a small general store in her community, as her husband is a rickshaw driver whose income is not sufficient to meet family expenditures alone. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy inventory of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy inventory of rice, sugar, and flour

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Aasia is a 45-year-old married lady and she has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Aasia makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan for 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Aasia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 54-year-old, married woman doing business selling milk for the pastfifteen years. She sells milk to many of her neighbours, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She is a mother of five children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through it's support. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 50,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en: Balqees is 50-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Maria Inmaculada

texts.es:
María Inmaculada de 34 años de edad, madre soltera con una hija de tres años que estudia sexto grado de primaria,  es originaria de la zona central de la región, esta mujer se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, persistente  y con muchas ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle a su hija un futuro mejor y su mayor y más grande sueño es ver formada a su hija en un profesional.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de nacatamales comida típica de la región, desde hace tres años que se dedica a su negocio, siempre por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para el sostén de su hija. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10  horas en dicha actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación y por encargo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabaja y comprar materia prima para la elaboración de nacatamales como hoja, cebollas, condimentos, cerdos, aceite, leña, bolsas, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  María Inmaculada agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a  personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Maria Inmaculada is 34 years old and a single mother of a 13-year-old daughter who is in 6th grade in primary school. She is originally from the central area of the region. She is known for being hardworking, responsible, and persistent with a desire for self-improvement. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources, she could not study for a degree. Currently, she strives everyday to provide her daughter with a better future. Her greatest dream is to see her daughter become a professional.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she has had a job selling nacatamales (a traditional food from the region) for 3 years in order to have a source of income to support her daughter. She works 10 hours at said job, which she does at home and by taking orders. The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and to buy raw materials to make nacatamales, such as leaves, onions, condiments, pork, oil, firewood, and bags so that in the near future she can generate better income. Maria Inmaculada is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide to poor countries like Nicaragua and low-income people so they can have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy raw materials to make nacatamales, such as leaves, onions, condiments, pork, oil, firewood, and bags.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Savun is 33 years old, married, and has three children who attend school. She is an experienced farmer from Prasat Bakong, Siem Reap province. She also runs a small business of tailoring clothes from her home. Her husband is a farmer. Savun has been involved in farming for many years and in tailoring clothes for almost 10 years.

Savun is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a seed husking machine to enable her to improve her farming productivity and earn additional income. She hopes to increase her farming products, to have better quality products, and to improve her finances. Her next goal is to open a tailoring shop in a public gathering area in her community, where she expects to make a high income to satisfy her basic living needs.

loans.use: to purchase a seed husking machine.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
Ravshan, who was born in 1977, is a very kind and hardworking man. He lives with his wife, 2 children and parents. Ravshan has been busy with his own business for more than 6 years. He buys goods from Kirgiziya and sells them in a local market. Ravshan develops his business little by little, with the passing of time. 

Ravshan is a repeat client of IMON. He used his previous loans for his business and has a good credit history. Ravshan is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS to buy clothes to increase his working capital. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to increase his working capital

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Even though Adjoa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. For the past 20 years, she has operated a business preparing and selling ‘kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves). Adjoa primarily sells her ‘kenkey’ in Abura, Cape Coast. 

Adjoa uses the income from her business to help her husband (a farmer) to raise their six children. Adjoa has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her ‘kenkey’, but she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase greater quantities of maize, leaves, etc. to prepare more of her tasty ‘kenkey’. Adjoa will use the new profits from her expanded business to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further their education.

loans.use: to purchase greater quantities of maize, leaves, etc. to prepare more of her tasty 'kenkey’.

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en:
Perpetua is a married woman and a mother of six grown children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has been involved in a farming business for several years. This is the source of her income.

Perpetua is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor for her farm, so she can be prepared for the season. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm and increase her yield and profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor for her farm

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 63-year-old, married woman. She has three children, with ages ranging from 20 to 25 years. She describes herself as a risk taker. She operates a grocery store, where she sells vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are local residents. She says that her biggest business challenge is a lack of enough capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to add to her stock of vegetables for resale. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be more competitive. She also does farming, to earn extra income.

loans.use: to add to her stock of vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married, with three children, selling cosmetic products, like lotion, perfume, and shampoo in their community, as an aid to her husband's income from driving in a motorcycle transportation service. For three years in her business, Mary Ann has earned so well that she was able to support her children's needs in their studies. 

Recently, she borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy more cosmetic products to resell. She is hopeful that, in the future, she will be able to build a sari-sari store and be able to earn a stable source of income, for a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to resell.

loans.name: Celina Jakuru

texts.en:
Celina is very much appreciative for the previous loan. She managed to improve her business. Now she has opened a retail shop that sells mixed goods.

Celina is now borrowing a loan worth 4000 SSP to enable her to buy more stock like rice, sugar, beans, and many other retail goods for the shop.

She says thank you to KIVA through Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, beans, and other retail goods.

loans.name: Ngoza

texts.en:
Ngoza is 25 years old. She completed high school in 2007, and is pursuing a diploma in accounting. She is the fourth-born in a family of six, and both her parents are unemployed.

Ngoza offers financial services, such as mobile money transfers and bill payments. She started running her business four months ago, to raise money for her education. She has employed one person to help her make transactions in the morning, when she is in school. She spends her afternoons serving her customers at her green booth, located at one of the busy bus stations in Lusaka, Zambia.

Ngoza’s biggest challenge is that she does not have enough money to satisfy her customers' demands. She is working with a low amount of working capital, which is not enough because her booth is in a good location, and she receives a lot of daily customers. Ngoza is requesting a Kiva loan to boost her working capital, so that she will be able to serve more customers who need to access financial services.

Ngoza is a very determined person. Her dream is to obtain her accounting diploma, and use the skills to expand her business by opening more mobile money outlets in Lusaka. She is very eager about this opportunity through Kiva. And she is working hard to continue developing her business and satisfying her customers, so that she can continue to pay for her education.

loans.use: to boost her working capital, so that she can serve more customers who need to access financial services.

loans.name: Noong Luong 1 Group

texts.en:
Tien is 25 years old and he is a Thai minority. He is working mainly at his family's agricultural production, including cultivating rice, vegetables and raising chickens with monthly average income of 2,300,000 Dong (VND), He lives with his wife and their small child who are at school age. With that income, his family's life is usually in deficiency, the child is malnourished and sometimes has to drop out of school to help parents to work on the field.

This is his first loan with ACE, he receives good recommendations for his hard work. Presently, he has one pig and a fishing pond, so he will use a portion of the loan to buy food for the pig and to buy more fish. He hopes that in the future, he could have a more stable income, therefore his family would be healthy, happy, and his child can attend school fully. 

Tien is the team leader of Noong Luong 1 Group consisting of 11 members, a majority of whom are Thai minority women. In the picture, Tien stands first from the left.

tag line: #Education, #FirstLoan, #SupportingFamily, #SustainableAgriculture

loans.use: to buy pig food and fish for a fishing pond

loans.name: Joyfe

texts.en:
Joyfe wants to become successful. She is still studying Information Technology at the university of Misamis Occidental. She used her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to pay for school tuition fees for the last semester. 

Recently, she borrowed another loan in order to pay the school fees for the current semester.  All these financial hindrances did not stop her from pursuing her ambition in life. She dreams of being able to finish her studies and work for a bright future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Tserenbal

texts.en: Mrs.Tserenbal is 24 years old and lives with her son in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt house, in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. She is divorced from her husband and is now taking care of her 2-year-old son while running her retail clothing business. She enrolled in engineering school but left her school soon after she got pregnant. She started her business after giving birth to her son next to her mother in the local market. Her mother taught her a lot about running a retail clothing business and running her family. She is now an experienced small business owner and needs 2,000,000 MNT to purchase large amount of clothes from Erlian, China to sell at her rental stall at the local market. She is a hard-working, positive and strong woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothes to sell at her rental stall at the local market

loans.name: Hawah

texts.en: Hawah is a single mother of one child. Her child goes to school. Hawah also takes care of an additional family member (young brother).  She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 4 years. She generates additional income from farming. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income from farming. She moves door-to-door selling used clothes and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to get a permanent business premises.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Risolatkhon

texts.en:
Risolatkhon is a farmer who has a sowing plantation. She has been in the agricultural business since 2009. She sells her agriculture products at the local market. She has a lot of clients who prefer her goods because she grows vegetables with good quality. She hopes that during some future years she will develop business and earn more income. Risolatkhon earns additional income from sewing national women's dresses. She is married and has a child who is 6 years old. Risolatkhon always tries for the well-being of her family.
 
Risolatkhon has acquired a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay for rental workers. She awaits your support and believes that your supporting her will make her living condition better.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and to pay for rental workers.

loans.name: Yovana Nancy

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de autopartes para carros,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio  y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de autopartes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar parabrisas,siliconas y llantas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The partner is still working in the business of selling auto parts. She has already been working 8 years in this business and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand the business of selling auto parts. She is requesting a loan to purchase windshields, silicon parts and tires. She is grateful for the given loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy windshields, silicon parts and tires

loans.name: Sarah Jean

texts.en:
Sarah Jean is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration, at Stella Maris College. She has four siblings, and they help in their parents' business, especially on weekends, to earn more income for the family. She used her previous loan from GDMPC to buy school materials and books for the last semester.

Recently, she borrowed a new loan. She will use this new loan to cover the costs of school fees and other miscellaneous expenses. She is hoping to finish her studies and support the family's needs, in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of school fees and other miscellaneous expenses

loans.name: Wuillian Alexi

texts.es:
Wuilliam, está complacido con los resultados que tuvo con el crédito anterior, ya que le permitió seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos y mejoro las condiciones de su vehículo.
En esta ocasión comprara llantas, bujías, y pagara revisión de motor de su moto taxi, con lo que atenderá muy bien a sus clientes, y estará dando un servicio con mucha seguridad.
texts.en:
Wuillian is pleased with the results he had with the previous loan because it allowed him to continue to give good service to his customers, increase sales, improve his income and improve the condition of his vehicle.

This time he will buy tires, spark plugs, and service the engine of his motorcycle taxi which will allow him to serve his customers very well and provide his service very safely.

loans.use: to buy tires, spark plugs, and service the engine of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with five children. She describes herself to be courageous. She operates a retail business where she sells caps and has been involved in this business for four years. 

Elizabeth's business is located in a competitive place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to add to her stock of caps for resale. 

Her business goal is to have a reliable business within five years. She hopes that in the future, her family will benefit from the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of caps for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 40-year-old married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be determined. 

Mary operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are all kinds of people in need of clothes. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

Mary will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase an extra sewing machine. Her business goal is to employ several ladies within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will empower young ladies. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: purchase an extra sewing machine

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en: Than, 38, is a villager from Sangke district in the Battambang province. As a single lady, she strives for a living by working at a construction site which has returned her around 33,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (a Kiva partner), Than is an eight-time borrower; her co-borrower is a four-time borrower who has joined her in a group of two to get a new loan from VisionFund. Than's previous loan, which she has repaid with success, has helped her to improve her living conditions. For this loan cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, Than will spend her entire loan portion on construction materials to support her occupation. She hopes that she can gain a good income from her job.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Sophea is a resident of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is a 34-year-old mother of two daughters and one son; two are school-children and one is too young for schooling.  To tackle the daily cost of living, Sophea grows rice and works for others for a fee. This is the second loan for Sophea with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). With her successful repayment of her first loan, she has managed to provide sufficient food for her kids. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy cows to support her rice farm.  She hopes to plant her rice on time with a good yield so that she can better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy cows for plowing her rice farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 42 years old and lives in West Point. She stopped her education at junior high level and has a 29-year-old child. Mamie is engaged in the sale of lappers (African cloths) in the local market. She don’t really sell in the rainy season since customers are fewer. Mamie is requesting a loan to purchase more lappers for her business. She plans to build a house for her children and marry in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers (African cloths) for her business.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is 46 years old and a married mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Zareena’s son who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Zareena has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her son. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Zareena is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Humaira

texts.en: Humaira is a 34-year-old married woman. She deals in a business of selling cloths in her community. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Humaira is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 29-year-old, married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business selling fancy clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality, formal clothes in her community. 

Nadia has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes in various sizes and designs by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina, age 45, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys baby goats at low prices and brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 35-year-old, married woman. Her husband has been doing business selling fruit on carts for many years. He is very enthusiastic in his business and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support his family. 

Parveen is a loving mother of seven children; one of her children is also shown in the photo. Parveen is motivated to provide them with food, good health and education. For the improvement of her husband’s business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase sacks of oranges, apples and guavas. This will help him increasing his sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of oranges, apples and guavas to sell.

loans.name: Muniran

texts.en: Muniran is a 53-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children; one of her sons is shown in the photo, who is doing business selling dry fruits on a cart. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support his family. For the improvement of her son’s business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase stock of dry fruits such as peanuts, walnuts, and almonds. This will help him to meet market demands consistently, which ultimately helps in generating more profits.

loans.use: to purchase stock of dry fruits such as peanuts, walnuts, and almonds.

loans.name: Oscar Cayetano

texts.es:
Oscar, se le ha presentado la necesidad de invertir en el negocio de cultivo de maíz y yuca, en esta oportunidad adquirirá insumos agrícolas tales como abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, insecticidas ya que con ellos preparará la tierra para sembrar sin ningún inconveniente.
Con el crédito anterior obtuvo una mejor cosecha, mayor producción de granos básicos, sus ventas aumentaron, obtuvo mayores ingresos. Su familia se encuentra muy saludable y mantiene el mismo núcleo familiar.
texts.en:
Oscar has been presented with the need to invest in the business of growing corn and yucca. With this opportunity, he will acquire agricultural supplies such as compost, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides with which he will prepare the land for problem-free sowing.

With the previous loan he had a better harvest, increased production of basic grains, increased sales, and higher income. His family is very healthy and he still has the same nuclear family.

loans.use: to obtain agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio, ve en los créditos una herramienta que le de mucha facilidad para fortalecer su negocio de una manera rápida, por lo que solicita capital para invertir en la compra de 4 cerdos y alimento para engordarlos, también utilizara una parte en la recolección de la cosecha, de esta manera poco a poco su negocio está creciendo.
Con el crédito anterior pudo comprar granos básicos y alimento para cerdos, sus ganancias son mejores, su economía es más estable y ha podido cancelar sus deudas, así como también da a su familia unas mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rogelio finds in loans a tool that helps him to strengthen his business in a much easier and faster way. That’s why he is asking for a loan to in vest in teh purchase of 4 pigs and pig feed to fatten them up. He will also use a part of the loan for harvesting, this way, little by little his business is growing. 

With the previous loan he was able to buy bulk grains and pig feed. His earnings are better, his finances more stable and he has been able to pay his debts. He has also improved his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 4 pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Blanca Claudia

texts.es:
Blanca, se ha decidió por un nuevo crédito para fortalecer su negocio de tienda y venta de comida, invertirá en la compra de carnes, verduras, bebidas, golosinas, y productos de la canasta básica. Con lo que tendrá variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes en estas fechas en las cuales su comunidad se encuentra de feria y hay mayor número de personas haciendo uso de sus servicios.
Con el préstamo anterior, invirtió en productos para su tienda los que le han hecho crecer su negocio, aumento sus ventas, sus ingresos son mejores, y a podido cancelar sus cuotas, así mimo continua apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios. Toda su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
Blanca has decided on a new loan to strengthen her store and food sales. She will invest in the purchase of meats, vegetables, drinks, candies and basic goods. With these purchases she will have a variety of products to offer her customers during this time of the year when her community is celebrating holidays and there are a greater number of people using her services.

With her previous loan, she invested in products for her store that have made her business to grow, increased her sales, made her profits better, and allowed her to pay off her debts, all while continuing to help her children in their studies. 

Her whole family is very healthy.

loans.use: to buy meats, vegetables, drinks, candies and basic goods.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally, 48, is a mother of five children. She is a villager from the Ponhea Krek district of Kamopong Cham province. To deal with the daily food consumption in her household, she grows rice and watermelon on one hectare, and works for others for a fee. She has been involved in this current business for 20 years, earning about 19,700 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Phally is the six-time borrower whilst her joint borrower is a five-time borrower. They are seeking a loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each for this cycle. Phally’s past loans, which she has completely repaid, have supported her living conditions at a gradual pace. 

Now, as the leader of her micro group of two, Phally will spend her entire loan portion to pay the reaping fee for her crop and to buy a water pump. She hopes that she can make more profit from her business so that she can renovate her house as well as expand her business.

loans.use: to pay the reaping fee for her crop and to buy water pump

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy is 53 years old, married, and has seven children. The main source of her income is from rice farming. This business has generated almost $6 per day for her. 

Dy has never received a loan through VisionFund Cambodia before. She is seeking her first loan to cover the school fees for her son. Dy hopes that her son can pursue his dream of studying for a bachelor's degree in Information Technology. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to cover the school fees for her son

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Los Angeles De 16 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANGELES 16 DE FEBRERO” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por once  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vanesa es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de deportivos, venta de chompas para bebe, servicio de niñera, tienda de barrio, venta de regalos, costura de deportivos, venta de lechugas, venta de camas, venta de ropa tejida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vanesa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió su hermana que tiene el mismo negocio en su zona, es por ello que decide realizar la réplica del negocio porque sus vecinos necesitan un centro de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fideos, azúcar, aceite, arroz, etc.) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente  lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Los Angeles 16 de Febrero” (Los Angeles February 16th) is starting its fourth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center.  This group consists of 11 members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Vanesa serves as the secretary.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as making sportswear, selling baby sweaters, providing day care services, managing a neighborhood store, selling gifts, selling lettuce, selling beds, and selling woven clothing.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Vanesa.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the organization.  Vanessa currently has a neighborhood store as her business.  She is knowledgeable about this type of work because she learned it from her sister, who also has the same type of business in her area.  For this reason, she decided to replicate the business because her neighbors needed a place to shop.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying noodles, sugar, oil, rice, and other products.  Vanesa acquires her inventory from wholesale distributors in the city of El Alto and then sells the products from her retail space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family.  Vanesa is in a common-law relationship and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Vanesa says that she enjoys the training seminars and the focus on health.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, oil, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Las Alondras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ALONDRAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Martina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta d pipocas de pollo, macramé de mantas, venta de jugos, venta de comida, venta de pollo, venta de ropa, servicio de minibus.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Martina es integrante, ella indica que hace un ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar que este producto se vende ampliamente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne, papa y arroz) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente  lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Las Alondras” communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a governing board.  Martina is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank are engaged in are varied and include selling popcorn chicken, macrame blankets, selling juice, selling food, selling chicken, selling clothes, and providing minibus service.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Martina is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for one cycle.  She joined by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling food.  She says that she undertook this business on her own initiative upon observing that this product is widely sold.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital to buy meat, potatoes, and rice, which she will get from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell it at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the components having to do with health.

loans.use: to buy meat, potatoes, and rice.

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESMERALDA” iniciará el vigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Clara es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción de papas y chicharrones fritos, venta en ferreteria, venta de comida, costura de mochilas, tejidos de prendas, tejido en macramé, confección de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Clara es integrante, ella indica que hace siete años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de macramé; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió ya que conocía la técnica de tejido, la que aprendió en un instituto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Esmeralda” communal bank will begin its 12th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  Clara is the president.  The businesses of the communal bank members are varied and include the production of potatoes and fried ‘chicharrones’ [fried pork rinds], selling hardware, selling food, sewing backpacks, knitting clothes, macramé, and making blankets.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Clara is a member.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven years ago by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a macrame business.  She says that she undertook this business because she knew how to macrame, which she learned at an institute.

The loan she will now take out is to increase capital to buy wool.  She will get it from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto.  After making her product, she will sell it at her sales stand.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health components.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: 6 De Abril Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “6 DE ABRIL” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, producción de polainas, venta de harina, venta de botones y sombreros, venta de mantas, venta de cables reciclados, producción de zapatos de damas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su madre que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sombreros; da a conocer que este negocio emprendió a concejo de un familiar que trabaja en el mismo rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de sombreros) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará a en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación y las reuniones.
texts.en:
The “6 de Abril” communal bank will begin its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch regional center.  It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors.  María is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and include a neighborhood store, leggings production, flour sales, button and hat sales, blanket sales, recycled cable sales, and the production of women’s shoes.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where María is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, joining by invitation from her mother, a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling hats.  She says that she undertook this business as she was advised to do so by a family member who works in the same field.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital to buy hats.  She will get them from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto.  She will later sell them at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the trainings and the meetings.

loans.use: to buy hats.

loans.name: Gulmahmad

texts.ru: Гулмахмаду 24 года. Он уроженец района Варзоб. В Варзобе у него семья, друзья и работа. Гулмахмад живет с родителями и братом. Он занимается восстановлением мобильных телефонов. Он окончил техникум и решил работать по специальности. Такой меленький бизнес приносит не много дохода. Но он только начал. Гулмахмад решил взять кредит и купить оборудование и запчасти для телефонов, чтобы ускорить свою работу и сделать качественнее результат. С такими планами он обратился за кредитом и с надеждой, что вы ему поможете!
texts.en:
Gulmahmad is 24 years old. He is a native of the Varzob region. In this region he has his family, friends and work. Gulmahmad lives with his parents and brother. He works with repairing mobile phones. He finished technical school and decided to work with his profession. Such a business does not bring a large income, but he just started it.

Gulmahmad decided to take a loan and purchase equipment and spare parts for phones, in order to speed up his work and make the result better. With these plans in mind, he applied for a loan with the hope that you will help him!

loans.use: to purchase equipment and spare parts for repairing mobile phones

loans.name: Ashirgul

texts.ru: Аширгул 40 лет. У нее среднее специальное образование. Она работает учительницей в сельской школе своего района Шахритус. Три года тому назад она параллельно начала еще одну деятельность - растениеводство. Аширгул вместе с мужем выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. У них имеется двое детей в возрасте 13 и 15 лет. После школы дети тоже помогают родителям в сельском хозяйстве. Аширгул сейчас обратилась за кредитом. Она хочет купить семена, минеральные удобрения и топливо, чтобы успеть закончить осенний посев.
texts.en:
Ashirgul is 40 years old. She has secondary vocational education. She works as a teacher at a village school in her region, Shahrituz. Three years ago, she started another business in parallel - crop cultivation. 

Ashirgul and her husband grow field crops. They have two children who are 13 and 15 year of age. After school, the children also help their parents with the farming. Ashirgul is currently applying for a loan. She would like to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel, in order to successfully finish the fall sowing.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is a 24-year-old. engaged lady. She is working as an instructor in a university, who provides education to new generations. Three years ago she started this career, and she is working hard on developing it.

Maya is getting prepared for her big day! That is, the day when she is going to start her own life and move forward with a brighter future. She is acquiring a Youth Loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary furniture and linens for her future house. She must finish buying these necessary things, since she is getting married soon.

This is her fifth loan cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and she has a paying back history in good standing. All her previous loans helped her a lot, in developing her socioeconomic situation and covering several urgent needs.

Maya is working hard on establishing her own business in the future. She will open a day care, because she adores dealing with babies.

loans.use: to buy furniture and linens for her future house, which she will occupy with her new husband soon, after their marriage

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina, 43, is a hardworking-married woman. Her husband is a master of repairing houses and they have two non-adult children. 

Zarrina and her husband try to provide their children with high quality living conditions. With this aim, seven years ago she began her own business selling  ‘kuraga’ which she sells to local people in a market. 

She buys apricots, which she processes and sells, and she manages this business alone. She wants to buy additional ‘kuraga’ to increase her business assets and continue selling her goods.

Zarrina is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy ‘kuraga’ to increase the working capital needed to develop her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy ‘kuraga’ to increase her working capital

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer, age 30, is a conservative person who would prefer not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. She lives with her husband and their eight children in a small village near the city of Tulkarm. They have five sons and three daughters, all of whom are under 18 years old.

As Abeer's husband is provided with an unstable wage, Abeer decided seven years ago to start up her own business in order to help him support the family. She has been engaged in her own project of raising sheep ever since. 

She would now like to improve her business and increase the number of sheep in her farm. She has therefore requested a loan from FATEN, which will allow her to add sheep and develop her farm. 

Through this loan, Abeer will be able to increase her production as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy sheep to add to her farm

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a single mother of four children. All her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling sweet bananas and has been in this business for 9 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of sweet bananas. She works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring   to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of sweet bananas.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a farmer living in Eldoret, where he has been farming for 7 years. He is married and has 2 children, both of whom are of school-going age. On his farm he produces and sells milk, vegetables, and maize, which he enjoys very much, but he experiences a challenge in a lack of adequate finances for carrying out his farming activities. Moses chose Juhudi Kilimo in order to access asset financing. During the training he learned a lot about group work and unity being key for growth in business. With his loan, Moses will buy animal feed for his cattle.This will cause his income to increase due to increased production.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Altanbayar

texts.en: Mr. Altanbayar is 39 years old and lives with his parents in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Uvs province, Mongolia. His parents are retired and stay home. He started his business selling animal pelts and other secondary raw materials at a local market in 2010. He also picks up larger amounts of products from herders in the countryside and sells them to bigger manufacturers in Ulaanbaatar once a month. He stopped his business for a while and now needs an extra investment to restart it, so he is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of animal pelts and other raw materials to sell to bigger manufacturers in Ulaanbaatar city. He is a hard-working, caring and diligent man who takes care of his parents.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animal pelts and other raw materials

loans.name: Fata

texts.en:
Fata lives in West Point and is 47 years old. She is married and her husband is a businessman, and they have nine children between 18 and 32 years old. For 17 years now she has been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community. 

She received a little amount from her husband  to start her business, and learned how to run it from her mother. She likes her business because she makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bonnie fish, spare ribs, rice, coal, and  pig's feet for her business. Her  plans are to build a house for  her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bonnie fish, spare ribs, rice, coal, and  pig's feet for her business,

loans.name: Mahduma

texts.en:
Mahduma has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Over time, she has become famous for providing good quality milk and has retained many regular customers. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

In order to inflate her sales she applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia has successfully built her business sewing clothes with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She stitches clothes for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. She has attained a good number of customers. Currently, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 through Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time and be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is currently in her 7th loan cycle with good credit history. She dreams of providing good education to her three children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in different colors.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 30 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Samina’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Samina has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and seat covers for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Samina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and seat covers for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Arlene May

texts.en:
Arlene May is a married woman with two children.  She manages a manufacturing business.  She has been doing this for more than two years and earns enough to supplement her husband's income. 

Arlene May used her previous loan from GDMPC to buy more clay to mold and sell, but she needs to have more stock. She requests a new loan to buy additional clay pots to resell. 

Arlene May desires to improve her business in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy additional clay pots to resell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a 28 year old single father of three living in Lyantonde. He is employed by a local hospital as a security officer. His income does not support him to save enough in order to buy a package of cooking gas. Previously Judy has been using a combination of firewood and charcoal for his home cooking energy needs and every time he has been very concerned about the dangers of lighting up a charcoal stove when his children were home. His fear has been that in case he gets busy with house chores, and his child gets burnt with the fireplace.  

A loan from KIVA will support Judy to access clean cooking energy from LPG. Due to the efficiency of LPG, Judy hopes that he will do away with dirty cooking fuels from charcoal and firewood. Judy is the first person in his family to commence using LPG as a clean cooking energy. Judy will no longer be worried about the dangers of Sigiri’s as he will be cooking from a raised fire place unlike in the past feared anything could happen to his children while cooking.

loans.use: to buy a clean cooking package so that he can avert dangers of traditional fuels

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton works and lives on the outskirts of Western Kampala in an area called Kibuye. He is single and works as a shop attendant at a local supermarket. Milton leaves home as early as 6:45am and returns home at 10pm. He does not have access to breakfast and evening tea at work. He can only manage to buy lunch and the money he earns does not support him to eat lunch and at the same time buy breakfast and evening tea at work. 
Milton is happy to use KIVA loan to buy LPG package, as this will help him to prepare breakfast prior to going to work and prepare dinner quickly on return from work.
Milton now has a package of cooking gas, will save on the costs he has been incurring on breakfast and dinner. He hopes to use the money he will be saving on eating from outside to help him save and rent a more spacious home so that he can start buying household items as he prepares to marry soon.

loans.use: to buy a package of clean cooking gas so that he can reduce on the cost of fuel in the house

loans.name: Mach

texts.en: Mach, 38, is a married mother blessed with three children. Nowadays, she only needs to support one schoolchild. To manage the daily basic needs of her family, she grows rice and her husband works at a construction site as a paid worker. Her business, which she has had for ages, has returned her about $3.50 US per day. After offsetting necessary expenses, she is able to save only about $1 US per day. This is the first microloan for Mach with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She will spend this entire loan to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue an associate degree majoring in Midwifery. She hopes that her daughter can obtain the degree and help others.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue an associate degree majoring in Midwifery.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Khei

texts.en: Khei is in his late 40s and  is a resident of Siem Reap province. He earns a living by growing rice on one hectare of farmland.  He also has a business selling sweets. This has been his business for more than 20 years. Khei, a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), seeks an education loan in order to pay the tuition fee for his son. He hopes that his son can pursue a bachelor's degree in Information Technology and get a good job.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for his son's education.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 27-year-old married man with three school-aged children. He lives in Masindi, Uganda.  He is a farmer and has a side produce business to earn additional income.  He started this business in order to improve his standard of living and to have a stable income.  However, he is challenged by unexpected weather changes that affect his productivity.  He hopes to educate his children through the university level.

Denis is asking for a loan to pay laborers to weed his fields.

loans.use: to pay laborers to weed his fields.

loans.name: Thanh An Group

texts.en:
Tuoi is 45 years old and she lives with her husband and daughter. All of the members of her family are farmers with monthly income of approximately 3,500,000 Dong (VND). Cultivating rice, vegetables, and cereal, and breeding chickens, pigs, fish, cattle are their agricultural activities.

In the past, they couldn't afford to pay for their daughter's tuition, that's why she had to quit her education since high school. Currently, they are working laboriously not only to cover living expenses but also in hopes of providing opportunities for their daughter to go to vocational school.

Mrs. Tuoi shares that she's facing difficulties such as lack of access to capital, severe weather in winter, and cattle and poultry diseases. She will use the loan to buy piglets, vaccines, and food for the pigs.

Tuoi is the team leader of Thanh An Group, which consists of 17 Thai ethnic minority women. In the picture, she stands on the first row at the first from right.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, vaccines and food for the pigs

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 32 year old single mother of four children. She is a midwife by profession. She resides at the hospital quarters together with her children. Dorothy wakes up at 5 am every morning to light up her sigiri (charcoal stove) so that she can prepare breakfast for the family. Sometimes they all miss breakfast if the charcoal is not enough for the day. The family either misses on main food or breakfast. 
Dorothy says that the cost of charcoal and its lack of availability are her motivation to buy LPG for her cooking needs. She acknowledges that LPG cooks faster and saves on time and money. Since Dorothy’s place of work does not provide lunch, she says, that it is now time for her to go back home during lunch time to prepare her own meals.    
Dorothy has been waiting for long time to buy cooking gas but unfortunately she was not able to save enough to buy the cooking package. She is grateful that at least there is a service which can enable her access the cooking gas package. 
LPG is cost effective but it appears expensive when one is acquiring complete packages. KIVA funding has enabled Dorothy to buy LPG package.

loans.use: to buy clean cooking energy from LPG in order to mitigate cooking costs

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a housewife who lives in a peri urban area of Kampala. She is a church usher, as she does not do any other meaningful work. Rose spends most of the days at home cooking food. She says that during week days she has trouble going to church as she has to cook for her family. The charcoal Rose buys for a week has to be able to feed her for the whole day and she cannot afford to cook in breaks because she is not able to regulate the heat of charcoal. 
With the attainment of an LPG cookstove package, Rose will be able to leave home and go to church more often rather than staying home all day. The KIVA fund will bring Rose’s friends nearer to her rather than keeping her away from them as LPG helps her to control the fire better than if she were using charcoal.

loans.use: to buy a package of efficient energy so that she can safe on household energy

loans.name: Abdurashid

texts.ru: Абдурашид продавец на рынке. Он занимается торговлей овощей. Ему 48 лет. У него жена и двое детей, с которыми он живет в районе Носири Хисрав. Дочери Абдурашида 17 лет, а сыну 14 лет. Они оба учатся в школе. Абдурашид занимается торговлей около 5 лет. Ей помогает жена - спутница жизни. Одновременно Абдурашид еще и предоставляет услуги такси. Он работает на двух работах, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Абдурашид просит кредит для торговой деятельности. На сумму кредита он собирается купить партию овощей для перепродажи.
texts.en:
Abdurashid is a salesman at the market. He works with selling vegetables. He is 48 years old. He has a wife and two children, who he lives together with in the region of Nosiri Khusrav. Abdurashid's daughter is 17 years old, and his son is 14 years old. They both go to school. 

Abdurashid has worked with sales for around 5 years. His wife - his life companion - helps him. At the same time, Abdurashid also provides a taxi service. He works two jobs in order to provide for his family. Abdurashid requests a loan for his sales business. For the loan amount, he intends to purchase a batch of vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for selling

loans.name: Dana Group

texts.en:
Jinan is the featured borrower of Dana group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to cover their needs and satisfy their desires. Jinan and the other group members decided to put their hands together to acquire this loan, because they have always been neighbors and friends who trust each other. Jinan is a 41-year-old married mother of three children, who has been working as a makeup artist from her house for thirteen years. She is very talented in her field and well known in her region.

Jinan is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy newly released makeup items, especially for the coming Christmas and winter season, and to invest part of the loan into buying necessary winter needs for her family. This is Jinan's fifth loan cycle through Kiva partner Al Majmoua, her previous loans helped her a lot by increasing her business tools and items. She works hard so that, in the future, she can open her own separate beauty salon outside of her house and provide her customers with necessary privacy. She is the first lady standing on the left. As for the other group members, Dolly is in the center, and Rima is on the right.

loans.use: To buy newly released makeup items, especially for the coming Christmas and winter season, and to invest part of the loan into buying necessary winter needs for her family.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio tiene 50 años, tiene una hija que está en Argentina y tiene 23 años.  El señor anteriormente tenía un autoservice, y con los años y con el dinero que junto se mudó a la ciudad de Luque trabajando en la venta de helados de forma ambulante. Actualmente cuenta con una fábrica de helados.
En el futuro le gustaría montar una Heladería grande, ya que en la zona hay una gran demanda por la temporada de calor.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para la producción de helados y así seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Antonio is 50 years old and has a 23-year-old daughter who lives in Argentina.  Antonio previously had a garage and, with after some time and having saved some money, he moved to the city of Luque and started selling ice creams as a street vendor.  He currently has an ice cream factory.

In the future Antonio would like to open a big ice cream store as there is a lot of demand in the local area during the hot season.

Antonio is applying for this loan in order to invest in supplies to make ice cream and to continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make ice cream.

loans.name: Rumilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Rumilda tiene 48 años esta casada hace mas de 29 años, tiene tres hijas. Es comerciante hace más de 8 años, tiene una Despensa y Carnicería en su casa, en la que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas, todos los días.
Son una familia muy trabajadora, todos se ayudan mutuamente, y la Sra. Rumilda atiende su negocio ya que su marido trabaja en otra empresa.
También dice que esta muy orgullosa de su familia y que su mayor deseo es que todos sus hijas estudien y sean profesionales para que puedan tener un futuro aun mejor.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio y seguir ofreciendo variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rumilda is 48 years old and has been married for 29 years.  She has three daughters.  Rumilda has had a grocery store and butcher shop in her home for eight years.  She works there every day from very early in the morning.

Rumilda's family is very hard working and everybody helps each other out.  Rumilda tends to her business while her husband goes out to work for another business.

Rumilda says that she is very proud of her family and that he biggest wish is for all of her children to study at university so that they may have an even better future.

Rumilda is applying for this loan to invest in buying beverages with which to stock up her business and to continue offering a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy drinks to stock up her store.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор трудолюбивая женщина. Она мать 6 детей. Ее муж Азизулло очень добрый человек. Гулбахор более 10 лет занимается купле продажей детской одежды. Гулбахор торгует на местном рынке. Она очень любит детей и поэтому всегда хочет, чтобы все дети одевались красиво. Она старается предоставить товары на высшем уровне своим клиентам. Гулбахор хочет увеличить доход и от полученного дохода, помочь нуждающимся детям канун праздника Нового года. Гулбахор запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки детской одежды для расширения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulbahor is a hardworking woman. She is the mother of six children. Her husband Azizullo is a very kind person. For more than ten years, Gulbahor is engaged in buying and selling children's clothing. Gulbahor trades at the local market. She loves her children very much and therefore all the children are nicely dressed. She tries to offer goods of the highest quality to her customers.

Gulbahor wants to increase her income and from the earned income to help children in need for the New Year holiday. Gulbahor is requesting a loan of 10,000 somoni to purchase children's clothing for expanding her working capital.

loans.use: to purchase new children's clothing in order to increase inventory

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio tiene 66 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de San Luis, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su relieve accidentado y hermosos paisajes verdes, ubicado a 02 horas del distrito, que pertenece a la Provincia de Cutervo, que se encuentra ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva cafeto tiene sembrado aproximadamente 02 ha de la variedad catimor, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, por lo que cuenta con mucha experiencia, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos con la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra y de esta manera tener una cosecha oportuna para ofrecer a un buen precio a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 66 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the village of San Luis, a rural area in the district of Santo Tomás, where the people work in agriculture and commerce. It is a community known for its rugged terrain and beautiful green landscapes, located some two hours from the district, it belongs to the province of Cultervo located in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Perú.

He works in agriculture, growing coffee and has planted approximately two hectares of a variety of Catimor coffee plants. He has been engaged in this activity for ten years and so he has a lot of experience. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles so he can maintain his crops by buying fertilizer and to provide payment for workers so that he can have a favorable harvest to offer at a good price to his customers, generating more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the cultivation of coffee and to pay laborers
